Title: Senior Research Software Engineer
Job description: The successful applicant will have experience, ability and practical success in scientific programming, research software engineering and/ or professional…
full-description:
Applications are invited for the post of Senior Research Software Engineer within the Environmental Change Institute. Our research programme, recently renamed the Oxford Programme for Sustainable Infrastructure Systems (OPSIS), has recently been awarded several research projects that rely upon high quality software engineering, data analysis, user interfaces and visualisation. OPSIS is a dynamic and innovative research team, with important links with government, industry and the international academic community. OPSIS has a strong sense of identity and is widely regarded for its innovative contributions in systems modelling, risk analysis and infrastructure policy. This post offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to high profile projects with the potential to have a major impact, both in research terms and upon policy and practice.
You will provide additional software engineering expertise to enable us to advance our research, generate new research results and provide worthwhile insights for decision-makers. Working with domain specialists, you will write code and produce analysis and visualisations that assist our research and applied activities.
You will have a PhD or equivalent experience in a relevant scientific subject and have the skills and experience to contribute to our research on sustainable and resilient infrastructure systems analysis and modelling. The successful applicant will have experience, ability and practical success in scientific programming, research software engineering and/ or professional experience in software development in relevant domains of research or industry (modelling, simulation, visualisation, spatial analysis). You will be proficient in relevant programming languages and will have knowledge and experience of good practice in software design and development. This will require excellent organisational, teamworking and communication skills.
An appointment at Grade 7: £32,817 - £40,322 p.a. may also be considered for a less experienced candidate (with a Bachelor’s degree minimum requirement and suitable adjustment of responsibilities).
This is a fixed-term post for 24 months in the first instance.
Informal enquiries about the role are welcomed. Please contact Tom Russell (e-mail: tom.russell@ouce.ox.ac.uk).
Applications for this vacancy are to be made online. You will be required to upload a CV and supporting statement as part of your online application.
The closing date for applications is 12 noon on Wednesday 5 January 2022, and interviews will be held in late January 2022.

Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
Job description:

Cloud Infrastructure Engineer – London, Suffolk or Gloucestershire – Permanent – £35…
full-description:
Cloud Infrastructure Engineer – London, Suffolk or Gloucestershire – Permanent – £35,000 – £68,000 per annum – Willing to undergo DV Clearance
Our clients are one of the UK’s leading companies at the forefront of Cyber & National Security. True digital pioneers, they shape the information age with one of the most powerful networks on the planet. They are hungry for new ideas, skills and experience. Our clients need people who want to reach their potential. People who aim high and share the ambition of a truly connected world
The Key Responsibilities of a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer:
· Providing the technical direction for the development and delivery of world class secure cloud-based solutions.
· Working directly with our customers to understand their requirements, and work collaboratively to define solutions.
· Be hands on in the build and development of cloud-based solutions.
· Translating architectural designs into infrastructure-as-code defined solutions.
· Working with support teams to enable management and monitoring of cloud-based systems, and their own going support.
· Providing some ongoing support to deployed cloud-based solutions.
· Ensuring compliance of cloud systems with security policies and regulatory requirements
· Either line manage or act as a mentor to more junior cloud architects and developers with responsibility for assigning tasks and their own going professional development.
· Responsible for designing and deploying world leading cloud-based solutions for our Customers.
· Mentoring and supporting the ongoing development of other members of the team.
· Sharing of best practice and new approaches with wider team.
Below is a list of Key Skills required for the Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, however you will not be expected to have everything:
· Utilisation of Cloud (both compute and appropriate managed services). Primarily in AWS with growth likely into Azure and GCP.
· Managing infrastructure as code (CloudFormation, Pulumi, Terraform).
· Cloud architectures and the ability to appropriately apply the relevant techniques e.g. AWS Well Architected Framework, Event-driven workflows.
· Use of scripting languages (Python, Powershell,etc) to define processes and serverless functions.
· Micro-service and container based deployment strategies, and a zero trust authorization model.
· Application of software engineering principles to complex systems at scale.
· Maintaining and operating capabilities through-life.
· Continuous improvement through Agile processes.
· A desire to continually update, enhance and validate cloud skills (both practical and certification).
· Certification in AWS is desirable, but practical AWS experience is more important.
· Experience in either line managing a team or mentoring and developing more junior team members, being responsible for their on going professional development.
Our client is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcomes applications from all backgrounds.
Benefits/Perks:
· On target Bonus
· Share options and 10% pension contribution
· Professional development and paid for industry certifications/qualifications
· Flexible benefits/rewards including dental insurance, healthcare, gym memberships etc.
· Well-being support for you and your family
· 3 days paid volunteering a year
· Flexible and smart working (subject to business needs)

full-description:
Senior Software Application Tester
Do you need a role that is challenging with a company that is using technology in new and innovative ways?
Can you be part of an international team who are providing new ways to provide KYC for key financial customers?
Do you thrive in environments where you will be working with deeply intelligent teams who love to explore what they can achieve with AI technology?
My client’s technology drives faster, better, and more cost-effective KYC at every stage of the relationship – liberating human effort to focus on decision-making rather than laborious research. They utilise artificial intelligence together with linguistic and cultural sensitivity and deep domain knowledge to set new standards for KYC quality, whilst transforming productivity and hardwiring compliance conformance.
Applying AI to extract precise open-source intelligence (OSINT) from vast corpuses of information – internet and deep web, news archives, watchlists and corporate databases. They provide the most advanced enterprise solution for KYC due diligence automation.
What are we looking for?
We want to find an intellectual and inquisitive Senior Software Application Tester to help develop the overall KYC product so that it remains optimised and extensible.
Most of their employees have always operated from home but if the candidate is London-based (which isn’t a prerequisite), there is the potential to occasionally join colleagues in a co-working space, in due course. Most colleagues are non-UK based.
What will you be doing?
This is a new and innovative software product; you will be part of a team developing the product to meet technology roadmap goals and providing customisations for individual customers
· Develop effective strategies and test plans
· Enforce best practices that drive product and engineering quality
· Manual testing of the products/customisations
· Create test metrics
· Documenting test results
What should you be great at doing?
Working closely with various members of the development team, we are looking for an experienced Software Application Tester to ensure that development of the product is safe, fully tested and bug free. You will be meticulous about test methods whilst being able to take those around you on the same journey.
What experience and knowledge do you need to succeed in this role?
Firstly, my client is a truly international company where communication across teams in different geographic locations needs to be strong. The business language is English, so the ability to communicate well in that language is essential.
Secondly, the product you will be working on is forefront in how it uses technology. You will not only be an excellent Software Tester, but you will also be intellectually curious and thrive in roles where you are constantly challenged with new things.
To succeed in the role, you need to be able to demonstrate the following.
· Able to understand business requirements
· 3-4+ years experience
· Good problem-solving skills
· Experience with API Testing ( Swagger, PostMan, Curl etc)
· Knowledge of test methodologies, tools and processes
· Understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
· Basic Linux and SQL knowledge
· Experience with Jira, git
· Fluent in English
Desirables:
· Europe / Flexible interfacing with both Asia and US
· Good analytical skills
· Strong self-reliance skills
· Good communication skills
If you feel you can demonstrate not only your excellence in Testing and Test Methods, but you inquisitive and intelligent nature together with great communication skills, please apply for this role. It could be the start of something that you will not regret.
Reference ID: DS Snr App Tester Oct 21

Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Job description: § Collaborate across Agile teams with Architects, Developers, Quality, Data, Security, and other Operations engineers on designing and implementing highly…
full-description:
Site Reliability Team Manager
About the position:
About the role:
Anvil, an Everbridge company, is looking for a skilled member of its SaaS Operations team with functional knowledge in all areas of technology operations and site reliability with particularly emphasis automation in a windows environment. The ideal candidate will fulfill the critical role of ensuring our systems are healthy, monitored, and designed to scale. The successful candidate should have hands-on experience in a web-scale role with emphasis on software-as-a-service. Candidates should also have experience designing, planning, implementing, tuning and operating technology including application servers, virtual machine & container management, migrating workloads to the public cloud, large-scale monitoring/trending techniques, micro-service architectures, clustering technology, configuration management and creative scaling techniques.
About the team:
As a member of our Operations team, you will join a team of dedicated, intelligent, fast-paced engineers. You’ll work in a hybrid cloud environment that will power our company’s impressive growth. You will bring a data driven approach to automation, security, scalability, & monitoring/alerting at Anvil.
What you'll do:
§ Own operational availability, security, scalability, efficiency, monitoring, instrumentation, and overall service reliability of Everbridge's solutions.
§ Collaborate across Agile teams with Architects, Developers, Quality, Data, Security, and other Operations engineers on designing and implementing highly reliable solutions.
§ Embrace engineering principles of proactivity, automation, cross-functional collaboration, curiosity, and data-driven decision making.
§ Enhance our infrastructure, tooling, and processes to extend operability as a self-service function for other groups within engineering.
§ Participate in a rotating on-call schedule to troubleshoot and resolve production escalations.
§ Have fun while we work hard to make a difference.
What you'll bring:
§ Bachelor's degree or equivalent
§ Large scale production Windows operating system, application, and security maintenance in an online web facing environment
§ Orchestration framework, configuration management, and software-defined infrastructure management techniques (i.e. SaltStack, Terraform, Kubernetes, Cloud Formation, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, etc.)
§ Automation experience with PowerShell
§ Application virtualization, containerization, and service-oriented-architecture technologies
§ Experience supporting & automating systems in a cloud infrastructure – AWS
§ Experience with data systems and distributed systems including Microsoft SQL Server
§ Network architecture and operations with an emphasis on: application load balancing at local and global scale (ELB/ALB/NLB/Route 53), IPv4 routing and dynamic routing protocols (OSPF, BGP), IPsec VPN, CDN, DDOS Protection, WAF, and network security best practices
§ Hands-on experience with infrastructure as code tools and concepts (e.g. Terraform/Kubernetes/OpenShift/OpenStack/SaltCloud)
§ Skill in at least one programming/scripting language. (e.g. PowerShell, Linux Shell .Net/C#, Python, Perl, Ruby, Java, Javascript)
§ Experience in supporting legacy datacenter equipment and migrating it to the public cloud using modern IaaS and PaaS best practices

Title: Senior Magento Developer
Job description:
Several years of experience in general coding and software design in in PHP 7.x in particular.
Senior Magento Developer – Full time work from Home*.
full-description:
Senior Magento Developer – Full time work from Home
About RedCloud
Open Commerce, RedCloud, and a $31TN race to market
Our mission is to grow global online commerce for the world’s small businesses by removing the barriers to online trading for hundreds of millions of independent retailers and their suppliers across the world’s supply chains. Despite the growth in e-commerce, less than 3% of B2B trading is made online, and yet, FMCG is Largest Product Category in the world - this is a $30tn business in emerging markets with over 1 million manufacturers, 20m distributors and wholesalers and finally over 500m independent retailers, who are the vital route to market serving over 7bn people every day.
When we ask independent retailers why they don’t trade online with FMCG brands, “we don’t know where to even start” is one of the top reasons we hear. That’s because selling, buying, and paying across B2B supply chains is long, complicated, and fragmented; Payments and purchasing are deeply manual, independent retailers have limited visibility on new products and sales opportunities, and FMCG’s (particularly up and coming brands) find it very difficult to reach new retailers and distributors and set up a rapid go to market. Due to antiquated payments networks, and the high cost of payment processing, over 19tn of trade payments are made offline, adding an enormous burden to online trading, with a 500m+ stores that function every day as powerful outlets for consumer brands, directly influence >80% of local consumer buying behaviour but they are often the least technically equipped with data, pricing, or the latest inventory.
The rapidly growing number of new brands, the rise of the middle-class consumer, and the growth in entrepreneurship has driven the need for a new kind of commerce dynamic, accessing key payment and sales points to enable FMCG’S, Distributors and sellers to trade smarter. So we built an Open Commerce Platform that enables the sale and distribution of FMCG products to be made much simpler. Products should be in front of sellers fast, in real-time, through an immersive commerce experience, with trade buyers and sellers able to see live commerce opportunities and pricing. We have built a digital ecosystem that is specifically designed to unlock the full value of the distribution network, providing real-time visibility for order and inventory management. Our innovative platform provides brands and distributors with deep data insights into buyer trends and behaviour and helps identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling products.
What you will be doing
· You will be involved in product design, scoping and estimation sessions alongside the Product and Project Management teams
· As a Senior Developer, you will take ownership of all Magento development within the company and help to grow our internal Magento development team including hiring new talent
· You will deliver and customise bespoke Magento modules and functionality including frontend, backend, and integrations
· Be able to estimate and then meet agreed delivery dates
· Participate in peer reviews of other team members’ code and provide mentoring to strengthen the team around you
· Liaise with our designers to build compelling user interfaces
· Provide of technical support and guidance to the wider ecommerce team relating to custom and core Magento functionality
We are looking for a focused and passionate individual to join us to develop RedCloud’s open marketplace solution on the Magento 2 platform as well as assist with scaling our in-house development team.
Your role will be to oversee our Magento architecture, build new features (both frontend and backend) and liaise with 3rd party teams. You should have demonstrable experience in the eCommerce space using Magento 2.3. You should be adaptable and agile in your approach, prioritising business goals and delivering high-quality solutions.
What you should have:
· Proven commercial experience as a Magento 2 Developer building and maintaining custom modules.
· Detailed product knowledge of Magento 2 Open Source including systems functionality and system architecture
· An understanding of the most popular third-party modules included in the standard Magento 2 installation
· Several years of experience in general coding and software design in in PHP 7.x in particular
· Familiar with the main database entities for Magento 2 on a MySQL platform
· Familiar with Magneto 2 front end development, html, CSS and templates customization
· Familiar with Magento 2 REST API endpoints and usage
· Experienced with CI and testing tools
· Proficient with GitHub code versioning, branching, merging etc.
· A solid understanding of both frontend and backend development best practices including secure development
· Strong understanding of web standards and best practices, especially pertaining to ecommerce
Other skills and experience which would be beneficial
· Ideally working towards or a holder of any Adobe certified Magento certification
· Has worked in an agile development environment
· Good communication skills
· Experience with caching systems like varnish and Redis
· Experience of scaling up a Magento platform to handle large customer volumes
· Able to write unit and integration tests
Benefits
Working with a pioneering provider of eCommerce solutions you will have the opportunity to join an international company who are growing massively, we encourage ambition and creativity.
Plus, you will get:
· First-class salary
· Private Healthcare and Life Assurance
· Pension Plan
· Company equipment
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: £50,000.00-£60,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Company pension
Flexible schedule
Life insurance
Private dental insurance
Private medical insurance
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work remotely:

Job description: This extends to an ongoing commitment to learning, with old and new technologies willingly learned as necessary to perform well in the role and new knowledge…
full-description:
Due to sustained growth, we are looking for talented full-time remote developers living permanently in the UK to join our team delivering high quality performant and maintainable solutions for both our own products and systems as well as our clients.
Almost all of the projects we work on are some form of web application and therefore as a full stack developer, you'll be working on everything from complex SQL queries to React components and everything in between.
We believe in developing ourselves and each other so our roles are ideal for developers looking for a company they can grow within. Every day is interesting and varied here so we offer the stability and comfort of a long term position without sacrificing variety and personal development.
We've worked remotely for years yet we collaborate a lot so you'll be expected to help others to complete their work and seek help from others when you need it too. This extends to an ongoing commitment to learning, with old and new technologies willingly learned as necessary to perform well in the role and new knowledge keenly shared with colleagues.
Required Technical Competencies
2 years+ working with .NET Core (C#) in a web application context
2 years+ working with SQL (MySQL/MariaDB preferred)
1 year+ working with ReactJS or a similar library
Core Competencies
Collaboration – Leverage our collective genius, be a team.
Transparency – Be real. Treat the client's money as your own.
Accountability – Recognise that if it is to be, it’s up to me
Passion – Show commitment in heart and mind
Advocacy – Earn trust and demonstrate integrity
Quality – Ensure what we do, we do well.
So what's in it for you?
Aside from providing an environment that is challenging yet supportive and collaborative, we offer:
Competitive Salary (typically £35,000 -£55,000 depending on experience)
Fully remote working with some time flexibility
30 days paid holiday + bank holidays of which 10 can be used at short notice as wellbeing days (for sickness, mental health) or emergencies.
All relevant tools and equipment are provided when needed.
Pension
About Rio IT Ltd
A group of hard-working, time conscious, professional and dedicated developers working on commercial projects for a range of clients across a range of different industries. On a daily basis, our team are working with our clients to solve their business problems or to realise business opportunities.
From a project management system for a construction company to e-learning platforms to real-time vehicle and asset tracking, no two projects at Rio are ever the same yet we approach all of them by putting the client's business requirements first and the technology second.
We believe in continuous improvement at the business, team and personal level and encourage everyone to voice their ideas.

Job Summary
At Bytron we believe that at the heart of every great company is a team of brilliant, driven professionals. We’re a values-led Company and aim to ensure all our employees feel valued, supported and motivated to achieve their very best.
Our aim is to exceed expectation and create innovative digital products that make information more accessible and useful, enabling people to achieve more.
As a member of the Production Team, the DevOps Engineer will work with and under the direction of the Chief Production Officer or to ensure that the design, configuration, implementation, and maintenance of physical and virtual environments that support our Product Development and SaaS data centres are maintained to high standards. The DevOps Engineer will act with reliability, maintain strict confidentiality, adhere to all Company policies and be a champion of the Company Values at all times.
Location
Headquartered in the North Lincolnshire village of Kirmington, we also have offices in Hull, East Yorkshire and fully support a remote working schedule.

Graduate Full Stack Web Developer
Cleveland Cable Company is the largest supplier of cables and cable accessories in the UK. Founded in 1978, we operate nine branches across the UK and Ireland supplying domestic and European markets. In 2016, we launched Dubai-based Cleveland Cable Trading FZCO to supply markets in the Middle East and Africa, taking our business truly global. Additionally, we own and operate Superlec Direct - an electrical wholesale, supplier and retail e-commerce website.
As part of our widening engagement with web and digital media, we are currently recruiting for a graduate level full stack web developer role based at our Middlesbrough head office. Working as part of the web team, successful applicants will be required to have:

- Skills with and knowledge of a front-end scripting language (jQuery preferred)
- HTML/CSS production skills
- Some experience with and knowledge of Adobe Suite software
- The ability to research, up-skill and cross-skill with web technologies
The role will involve:
- True full stack development – including front-end production, UI/UX development, bespoke PHP/MySQL development, and server admin
- Working within a team on larger projects, broadening into taking full ownership of development on smaller projects when settled in the role

Title: Senior Developer (C#/.NET, MSSQL)
Job description: We are experts in web development and design, intranet development, app development, content management systems, database systems and software development.
full-description:
We are seeking an experienced developer to work on the C# .NET custom web applications and MSSQL database systems that we design and build; our clients are mainly public sector and our solutions are often high profile.
You will engage with each project from requirements analysis through all stages of the build and testing, and will create Database Schemas, Software Specifications and Test Plans. You will work both independently and as a Lead Developer within a project team, working across a diverse portfolio of projects, both for existing clients and new ones.
Unusually, we offer the opportunity to develop on both Linux and Windows stacks. The focus of this role is C#/.Net development in Umbraco, but we are very keen to talk to candidates who can in addition demonstrate experience with PHP 7+.
You will create clean, structured code that is well-documented and compliant with GDPR and accessibility guidelines, and web standards. As a senior member of our team, you will identify opportunities for efficiency and improvement, such as building core code libraries, as well as mentor junior developers and contribute to standards development.
We are looking for an excellent developer who wants to make a difference through continuous improvement of themselves and the wider team you work with.
Experience
A minimum of 5+ years’ similar experience in an agency or environment with multiple customers
Qualifications
Degree level qualification in a relevant subject
Essential Skills
· C#/.NET
· MSSQL
· JQuery
· rest APIs
· HTML
· CSS
You should also be fully conversant with web standards and WCAG 2.1 accessibility and have a good understanding of GDPR, creating secure web applications, the latest security threats and mitigation against them.
Evidence of professional development though industry courses or accreditations would be welcome
Desirable Skills
· PHP7+
· PostgreSQL
· Javascript
· Coding for open source CMS’ e.g Umbraco or WordPress
· Experience of MVC and unit testing
· Agile
Qualities
The ideal candidate will be an excellent, pragmatic problem-solver and an enthusiastic and supportive team player, willing to get stuck in and provide excellent support to the team members around you.
We’d love to see good interpersonal skills with the ability to explain technical matters to non-technical clients and staff. You should be able to work on multiple projects at once and work well under pressure.
You should take pride in your professional working practices, expecting high standards of yourself and others around you.
We really want to talk to candidates who are passionate about keeping up to date with the latest software development methodologies and technologies and have a real enthusiasm for web technology.
About us
Connect is a specialist provider of award-winning web solutions. We are experts in web development and design, intranet development, app development, content management systems, database systems and software development. Our clients include the DVLA, HMRC, HM Treasury, NHS Education for Scotland, the Welsh Government, North West Air Ambulance, Cardiff University and Hewlett Packard. We operate a hybrid working model, partly in our city centre office and with the option to work from home for part of the week.

Title: Java Developer
Job description: At least 3 years working in commercial software development (preference given to candidates submitting ‘References’ evidencing this experience).
full-description:
Company description
Based in Leeds, UK, DATAHONE are an innovative provider of factory data analytics to the manufacturing sector. The systems we deliver to our customers, help them to improve their productivity by delivering near real-time performance dashboards on all aspects of their machines and orders.
Our customers could be putting ketchup in bottles or machining a part the latest Airbus. DATAHONE enables them to do this more productively, with up to the minute analysis of factory performance.
We are ambitious, fast growing and expect to lead our market (by revenues) in the future. DATAHONE is an exciting, varied, dynamic environment and forever innovating with technology. Within this environment, you can grow your experiences and your career skills. Nothing is mundane, much is a new experience.
We offer good salaries, benefits and environments in which to work.
Job description
1. Job title.
Software Engineer (Java focus)
2. Background and Role
DATAHONE service offerings use ‘Industry 4.0’ components, services and frameworks integrated in to ‘out-of the-box’ services ready to use as soon as they are installed and connected. DATAHONE manages the complexity, so that the client doesn’t have to.
Reporting to the technical director you will continuously develop and improve our web apps, dashboards and mobile content by adding and refining features in accordance with the roadmap. To do this you will have to work with data collected from customer on-site equipment and deliver back contextual analysed dashboards, alarms and apps to our customers in a meaningful and efficient manner. You will be responsible for creating and adhering to comprehensive, fully budgeted project plans and “right first time mentality” is essential. Part of the role is meeting with customers, listening to them regarding their specific needs and translate that in to a technical deliverable.
We develop using platforms such as Vaadin, Postgres and in addition to Java use development languages python, pearl, C++
3. Responsibilities
Design and implement new components and integrate them into our existing products. Take ownership of the codebase and follow a defined testing procedure before production deployment. Innovate and find new ways to improve our customers experience.
4. Skills and experience
Essential

Title: Front End Developer
Job description:
Someone who can take web designs and turn them into a reality.
You’ll be responsible for creating and maintaining customer facing websites, along with being…
full-description:
We want an individual who creates digital customer experiences that enable the Rix Group to expand its online footprint.
Why Us?
Our business has had a reputation as one of Yorkshire’s top employers for 150 years, and now we’re building an internal digital agency to revolutionise the way our 17 businesses operate.
If you like variety, discussing challenges with knowledgeable individuals and working in an entrepreneurial environment then this is the opportunity for you.
Who Are You?
Someone who can take web designs and turn them into a reality.
You’ll be responsible for creating and maintaining customer facing websites, along with being heavily involved in the creation of user interfaces for exciting projects such as Expensemate.
You’ll love technology, staying up to date on the latest and greatest tools. Not only that but you’ll like talking about it with other like-minded individuals and experiment for fun.
We’ll listen to any ideas you have too, so hopefully you have a few.
More on Us
JR Rix and Sons Ltd is a dynamic business with 150 years’ worth of tradition, mixed with a forward-thinking attitude and commitment to change.
Starting out in the 1870’s as a shipping company, the group is involved in several industries that have developed along with Hull and East Yorkshire’s changing economic climate. Activities range from software development to renewable energy, to providing fuel to homes to caravan manufacturing. There’s always something new around the corner too.
As part of a drive to revolutionise the way the group operates, digital transformation has been made a strategic priority, with dedicated space for innovation in their stylish new head office overlooking Hull Marina, several new hires across the business and the creation of an internal digital capability to service the demands of the business.
Key Deliverables:
- Create and maintain stable websites
- Build user interfaces and prototypes from wireframes and designs
- Support front-end development of web applications
- Stay up to date on the latest technology and bring forward ideas
Required Skills
· A solid basis of knowledge on web development: HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP
· An appreciation of UI and UX
· Understand and apply relevant testing development practices
· Problem solving and attention to detail
We would love it if you had:
· Experience in headless CMS
· Experience with React
· Understanding of database logic
Perks:
- State of the art office space with Innovation Hub
- Gym within the new office building
- Flexible working location
- Casual attire
- Employee expense card
Schedule:
- Monday to Friday
Salary
- £25-35k
Next Steps
- Interviews can be held remotely or in person. If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and we shall look forward to speaking with you as soon as possible.

Salary: £25,000.00-£35,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

full-description:
ANRA Technologies is seeking an experienced and self-motivated Front-end AngularJS or React or VueJS Developer to join our international based team of software developers. This position is an immediate need, and we are looking for a candidate with availability to start over the next few weeks.
* Currently a remote position until further notice
Company
ANRA Technologies headquartered in Washington DC with additional offices in London and New Delhi is an international provider of end-to-end drone operations and traffic management solutions for unmanned aircraft operators and airspace managers. These software products offer intelligent and modular traffic management software capabilities for Unmanned Aircraft Systems Traffic Management (UTM) and Urban Air Mobility (UAM, or flying taxis) operations. Guided by our shared values, ANRA thrives in an environment marked by collaboration and openness. We believe that innovation is powered by teamwork and that respect for each other leads to superior results. Driven by these principles, our team is building capabilities that will impact the future of aviation.
Technical capabilities
Experienced in Angular and VueJS based web applications that work on a variety of interfaces.
Extensive experience in working with and consuming RESTful APIs and web services.
Excellent HTML-5 /CSS3 skills are required.
Experience in Javascript min - 2 years.
Proficient Knowledge in VueJs Or ReactJs
Knowledge of store management like Vuex, Redux .
Knowledge on GIT, GITHUB, NPM, Webpack.
Knowledge of Container like Docker will be a plus.
Additional skills
Atlassian suite (Jira, confluence .etc)
Git flow, feature branching
Scrum methodology
Close working with UX and IA team
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree Computer Science or equivalent.
Familiar with Agile methods like Jira, Bitbucket.
5 year min of relevant experience.
Excellent communication skills, oral and written.
Self confidence, flexibility and a results driven attitude.
Ability to work in a small, fast paced, collaborative environment.
Positive attitude with a willingness to help team members and provide excellent customer service to clients.
Linux skills are a plus but not required.

Title: Salesforce Developer - SF Communities Exp. required.
Job description: Working with Salesforce clouds and third party software to find solutions, improve productivity and provide digital tooling to our end users.
full-description:
About us:
At Aspect, we are a creative bunch. Over a decade ago we set about creating a leading Property Maintenance firm that would challenge convention and offer the utmost in service delivery. Since then we have grown from strength to strength, now completing more than 30,000 visits per year, we maintain some of London's most exclusive homes & commercial premises.
Those past 10 years have seen 3 Office moves, over 1000 operatives, plenty of hair-raising incidents, a creative approach to property maintenance, but a static software platform.
As the ever-changing landscape evolves for our customers & operatives, we are turning attention to our digital offerings. We have intentions to transform the way our partners are able to interact with us, once again looking to challenge conventions & improve our clients' experience
About Our Tech team.
We are a team on a mission to build the world’s best property maintenance software.
We’re reimagining the expectations for tradesmen & homeowners, we believe when looking to find, schedule & carry out works with a tradesman, our platform should be the only viable option.
Property maintenance is one of the largest, yet least digitized sectors on the planet. We have a roadmap of features that will disrupt the industry and shape the expectations of a generation, for property maintenance delivery,
We believe homeowners should be empowered to better understand the maintenance process, while not needing to concern themselves with being overcharged. Tradesmen should expect the ability to earn fairly, with immediate payment, while having their portfolio of work and feedback progress themselves towards longer-term rewards with a clear career path.
We have already since our products launch in 2019, proved the benefit we can bring to commercial customers, now it's time to show the world.
Role and Responsibility:
Providing solutions for our creative team.
Working with Salesforce clouds and third party software to find solutions, improve productivity and provide digital tooling to our end users.
Working under the Project Manager, to sprint cycles.
What about you:
We would like to meet with a like-minded Individual. That is to say, you must be passionate about your work, a forward thinker, and only willing to settle for an industry-leading product.
You will have experience as a Salesforce Developer, particlury with Salesforce Communities while hopefully some front end skills such as React, Redux, HTML, CSS, Springboot, Lightening UI.
If you feel that your skills are on point, and you are confident you are up to speed with cutting edge trends across tech, design, and digital markets, we want to hear from you.
This is a great opportunity to secure a pivotal role in the business future, while also bringing new skills to the team. You will be working with a creative team, experienced Property Maintenance insiders & some outstanding tech developers, to bring our innovations to life.
Requirements:
A motivated, talented individual who’s keen to start providing input and provide guidance as to how we can achieve our objectives. With extensive experience in Salesforce Communities essential.
Highly proficient as a Salesforce developer, including relevant hands-on experience with Visual Force & Triggers.
Programming experience: visual flows, process builders, workflows, SOQL & SOSL,
2 years of Salesforce experience as a minimum is preferred, with the following certificates essential.
Knowledge of Custom APEX, AURA Components, javascript/JSON
Salesforce Certified - Platform Developer (PDI)
Object-Oriented programming language, such as Java, JavaScript, C++, Mark Up oriented programming language, such as HTML, XML, CSS.
We want to hear your perspective on the future of the service industry. What inspires you, see examples of your work, and hear your thoughts on Salesforce and systems.
Please provide details of Salesforce clouds that you have worked within. For example service cloud, field service, communities.
Working Hours, Salary & Benefits:
£50-£65,000 annual basic salary depending on the experience.
Free drinks on our Friday social nights.
Perkbox membership.
Eligible for bonus scheme.
Employee Pension Scheme (if applicable).
20 days of annual leave plus 8 bank holidays (prorated for PT/OOH).
An additional ½ day paid leave should the day of your birthday fall on a weekday.
Our newly refurbished offices are based in Chessington KT9, a 2 minute walk from Chessington South Station.
If the above role applies to your strengths and sounds of interest to you, please send us a copy of your CV and a brief cover letter outlining why you feel that you are the candidate we are looking for.

full-description:
We are looking for a Software Engineering manager who's passionate about creating empowered, high performing teams. You don’t need to have come from a Software Development background, but ideally you’ll have experience of coaching/leading software engineering teams and have a passion for nurturing talent.
Our client have a huge focus on building an envious culture, and ensuring employees feel valued and supported through every step of their career with them. This has created a wonderfully positive environment, as well as a close knit, high-performing team of individuals who are keen to learn from each other and grow together.
The Software Engineering Managers time will be split between supporting their team and conducting one to ones, working closely with other Engineering Managers and product teams, supporting product strategy, coaching and mentoring and recruitment, where you’ll work with both internal & external teams.
Part of the role will include organising weekly internal hackathons and offering external training opportunities, through hands-on technical workshops.
We are looking for someone with the following;
· 3 + years experience managing high-performing software engineering teams
· Clear, positive, and honest communicator
· Eagerness to see people thrive and grow
· Passionate about implementing a learning culture
· Ability to seek out ways to improve and innovate
· Experience supporting and creating strategy
· Experience of hiring and interviewing to support team growth
The Software Engineering Manager role is paying £65,000 with 25 days holiday + additional day for a celebration of your choice. Life assurance, innovation days, quarterly hackathons, employee perkbox and remote working.
If this Software Engineering Manager opportunity sounds of interest to you and you'd like to find out further information, then please send your CV to Fusion Talent and one of the team will be in touch.

full-description:
Job Overview
At Holosphere we are doing awesome things with Extended Reality Reality, due to expansion we're now looking for an experienced Software Architect / Product Innovation Lead to join our team and help us achieve our exciting new growth goals.
You will join our team of talented creative artists and pioneering technologists at our Birmingham Immersive Technology Studio. The role will involve work on an exciting range of immersive solutions, such as solving problems for large enterprises using mixed reality, VR research and development and some time dedicated to creative innovation. We tailor VR solutions for audiences, using both room-scale VR and 360˚ video for the latest state of the art VR devices. Unreal Engine (UE4) is at the heart of everything we do - so a passion for this is essential.
We tailor VR solutions for audiences, using both room-scale VR, Immersive projection spaces and Augmented Reality.
Duties and Responsibilities
· Lead the development and innovation of the product suite
· Architect, write and maintain clean, commented code individually and as part of a team
· Provide creative and innovative solutions to help optimise applications for VR output
· Design and produce in-house UE4 tooling for UE4
· Troubleshoot and debug a variety of day to day studio issues
· Mentor and train junior team members if required
Skills and Experience
Required
· 3 years experience with C++
· Experiencing leading or delivering software products
· Knowledge of Unreal Engine
· Ability to modify and build engine source code (UE4)
· Proven experience developing optimised applications for room scale VR
· Good working knowledge of Perforce and UE4/VS integration and best practices
Great to have
· Dev Ops Experience
· Experience developing in C# for Unity
· Experience with Windows batch scripting
· Experience with JavaScript
· Shader skills (glsl/hlsl)
· Experience with ARCore and/or ARKit
· Experience working with OpenVR/OpenXR
Qualifications
· Computing / Development related degree or ability to demonstrate equivalent work experience
· A-Level graduate
About Holosphere VR
We are a Birmingham-based immersive technology company, specialising in Virtual and Augmented Realities as well as 3D projection. A team of creative artists and pioneering technologists who feel passionately about the potential Extended Reality has to promote positive change in the world. Our founder started Holosphere VR with the goal of building a technology hub with a skilled team, to create unparalleled business solutions. We craft world-class, immersive solutions that make a positive impact, and partner with clients of any size to achieve stunning results.
Find out more about us at www.holosphere.co.uk

Title: Senior IT Systems Developer
Job description: The Traveleads IT team is responsible for developing and maintaining in-house software and databases, integrating our software with APIs from external providers…
full-description:
The rare and exciting opportunity has arisen at Traveleads for a skilled IT Systems Developer to join our growing company.
Traveleads is an independent travel agent, specialising in Business travel and groups travel, particularly for sporting organisations. Traveleads is based on the outskirts of Leeds (postcode LS11 8EG) near the White Rose Shopping Centre.
The Traveleads IT team is responsible for developing and maintaining in-house software and databases, integrating our software with APIs from external providers, reporting on the data we hold, maintaining and improving the network and associated hardware and software.
The role of IT Systems Developer at Traveleads will accelerate development of new functionality in order to improve the technology available to bookers and Accounts users, and to increase the number of systems that can integrate into our systems.
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Traveleads (registered as Deehurst Limited) has been established since 1971 with offices in Leeds and Edinburgh city centre focused on Corporate and Sports & Group travel as well as our Harrogate branch specialising in high-end leisure travel.
We have an ambitious five year plan for expansion having bought three travel management companies in the past two years to improve our internal capabilities to best service our clients.
Our independent status allows us to provide a truly personalised travel service, ensuring our client gets the best value possible without compromising on quality.
CONTRACT and REWARD
This vacancy offers a permanent contract of £40,000-£44,000 based on experience.
Working hours are 37.5 per week, Monday-Friday 09:00-17:30 including a 1 hour lunch break.
Company perks include:
–Total of 30 annual leave days (including bank holidays) each year
–Employer pension contribution of 5%
–Free car parking
–Free use of the onsite gym (based on COVID19 restrictions)
RESPONSIBILITIES
Key responsibilities include:
· Work with the wider operational team to implement IT solutions to improve the companys processes and in turn the client experience.
· Write new functionality in C# using WPF and ASP.NET
· Gather requirements for new functionality, generate design documentation and implement new functionality based on those documents
· Generate reports for internal and external users
· Maintain and enhance existing VB.NET WinForms applications
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
The successful applicant will have experience of:
· C# with Visual Studio 2013 or later
· WPF and ASP.NET development
· T-SQL or SQL Server
· Making REST calls and parsing xml information
It would be beneficial if the developer had experience of some of the following:
· VB.NET
· Windows Forms development
· Source Control using TFS
· LLBLGen Pro
· Travelport Smartpoint SDK
· HTML and CSS
· WPF
· Web application deployment using Azure
In addition to these technical requirements, the candidate should be able to demonstrate:
· Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to multitask and prioritise.
· Effective communication skills and a positive contributor to the wider team.
· A motivated and proactive individual who is representative of the Traveleads brand
· The ability to work independently and to work in a team, depending on the requirements of a specific task.
· Excellent attention to detail and the ability to deliver high quality output to tight deadlines.
HOW TO APPLY
If you are a team player with ambitions to be part of a growing company that operates with integrity, and meet the requirements of our desired candidate, apply today!
Please email us your cover letter and CV to apply, alongside any questions you may have.

Title: Senior PHP (Laravel) Developer. What's your point of Vue?
Job description:
Some bean bags and a table tennis table.
We have a great plan for zapping inefficiency and wastage in an old-school industry.
full-description:
Indiana Jones is looking for stuff then suddenly he’s running from a bloody great big boulder. Final-act stuff in most movies, but Raiders began with a bang and ramped it up from there.
Well, that’s what this job is like, except it won’t end with your face melting or propellers slicing your head off (hopefully).
We’re a small, friendly and collaborative bunch. It’s your typical small office business really. A few rows of desks and laptops. Some bean bags and a table tennis table. And some sweets on reception.
We have a great plan for zapping inefficiency and wastage in an old-school industry. It’s not glamorous. It’s not Biotech or Fintech. (We’ll think of a cool term right after we sort those sweets.) But it is leading-edge stuff in the business intelligence, analytics and market insight space. And if you have a strong sense of community so much the better.
We’re not looking for newbies. You’re a raw, hungry developer who wants to be trained and nurtured? Good luck – but sorry, see ya. We need a senior developer who can hit the ground running and deliver from day one.
You won’t find any prima donnas here. Our world is full of deadlines that must be met. Stop press is simply not an option. Stress levels inevitably rise as these deadlines approach so you’ll need to be comfortable working under pressure and adept at keeping those plates spinning.
Must-have exposure? Vue.js, PHP (Laravel). For you, software isn’t a job, it’s a craft. You’ve got a GitHub repository. You’re involved in meetups, forums etc. You own a hat and a whip (optional).
Culture is as important to us as it is to you. If you thrive in client-facing environments, enjoy interacting with both technical and non-technical audiences and love nothing more than taking an idea from mere concept to actual implementation then you’ll fit right in.
We’re evolving, pivoting quickly, chucking out stuff that doesn’t work. We’re surrounded by coffee shops so we’ll be brainstorming in those.
And the £££ isn’t your usual startup peanuts. We are looking at up to £95,000 plus benefits.
Interested to know more? get that CV and covering letter to us. No covering letter, no good. And don’t look at the Ark!
Reference ID: MGTX
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: Up to £95,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Title: Javascript 3D Developer
Job description: Closely working with our producers, coders, graphic designers, and digital artists you’ll help us create, modify and maintain projects across a range of scope…
full-description:
Pikcells are award winning creators of CG images and interactive web based projects working with a global network of clients in the home interiors and furniture industry. We employ about 30 energetic and innovative people who share our vision to be the best at what we do and have fun doing it.
We’re looking for a talented Javascript 3D developer to join our team to help produce unique and engaging web experiences.
We work on a broad range of tools and products where 3D technology converges with web applications. You will get to work with the latest VR, AR, web tools as well as building next generation product configurators.
This is a unique opportunity to be part of a dynamic, talented and fast growing company where your ideas and contributions make a real difference.
You’ll be working in an environment where visual quality is key. Closely working with our producers, coders, graphic designers, and digital artists you’ll help us create, modify and maintain projects across a range of scope and budgets.
Your responsibilities will include helping build progressively enhanced and responsive WebXR / 3D / 2D web applications running in WebGL frameworks [threejs/babylon etc.]. These must run on a range of hardware from low powered mobile devices to high-end VR gaming PCs.
The work will be constantly evolving and varied, usually requiring a number of unique solutions to be designed for each project. It’s never boring.
Job Responsibilities
Building, developing and maintaining new and existing online experiences
Work closely with our R&D team to develop interactive 3D and 2D web-based products
Producing well-documented and beautifully crafted solutions using emerging web technologies [WebXR/Canvas/ES6]
Be able to learn and use new APIs, SDKs or programming languages as necessary
Collaborate with producers, coders, graphic designers, and digital artists to build high quality/performance web applications
Be willing to explore opportunities enabled by new technologies
Research, analyse and explain possible approaches to unique problems
Experience Required
Advanced knowledge of HTML5, CSS, DOM, and JavaScript
Demonstrable experience with Web APIs, especially WebGL, WebXR and Canvas
One or two years of Javascript 3D [three.js etc.] experience or 3D experience in other programming languages
Comfortable working with various build and task automation tools, including Webpack, Gulp, Grunt
An interest in online web technologies
Desirable, but not essential
GLSL experience
Video game industry experience
Good understanding of GIT and approaches to version control
Amateur or Professional game development experience
Knowledge of Game Engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal etc).
Cross browser and Cross device development

Title: Graphic Designer
Job description: You will be creating a wide range of graphics and layouts for social media, external and internal marketing collateral and websites with software such as Adobe…
full-description:
NeoTech utilises the extensive skill set of its group partners and maintains a pool of knowledge with its development teams to develop software that delivers business value.
When we commit to organisations to provide solutions using our DevOps/Agile culture, we create an environment for our high-performing global teams to solve business problems, increase enterprise value and reduce risk through technical excellence.
We are looking for a Graphic Designer to join our Neo Tech team. You will be designing a wide variety of things across digital and offline media. To be successful in this position, you’ll be a self-starter, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas and showing amazing attention to detail.
Are you a Graphic Designer looking for the opportunity to grow in a flexible, forward-thinking team?
As a Graphic Designer your duties will include working with our client to understand the problems they are trying to solve, work with the developers to plan stories, and take the lead as the PM throughout the development projects. The role will also involve managing timelines, resolving problems and managing the offshore dev team. Ultimately, you’ll help manage self-organising teams that are flexible and fully productive during sprints. This is an exciting opportunity to make a big impact within a supportive and growing company. Above all, you will have a love for digital technologies and the great potential technology can have.
Location: Leeds (Yorkshire)
Graphic Designer Daily Responsibilities
You will be creating concepts by studying relevant information and materials.
You will be preparing finished art across print and digital media.
You will Coordinate and communicate with graphics services, marketing, printers, and colleagues as necessary.
You will be contributing to team efforts by accomplishing tasks as needed.
You will work closely with sales and marketing team providing them with all materials required for new layout and design.
You will assist Design and Account teams with any ad-hoc requests
You will be creating a wide range of graphics and layouts for social media, external and internal marketing collateral and websites with software such as Adobe creative cloud.
A basic understanding of website UI and UX using design to improve customer experience
You will be reviewing final layouts and suggesting improvements when necessary.
Graphic Designer Requirements:
A Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or related field.
2 years+ Experience as a graphic designer or in related field.
Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio.
Proficiency with required desktop publishing tools, including Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator.
Ideally an understanding of Microsoft office suite with the ability to turn layouts into PPT or Word templates.
A strong eye for visual composition.
Effective time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
Able to give and receive constructive criticism.
Understanding of Marketing, Video editing, Adobe Creative Cloud, CMS & website design, Email design, advertisements for all channels.
General:
You will understand, model and promote the company Values
You will comply with Health & Safety policies and procedures
You will be aware of and ensure the implementation of the company’s policies and procedures
You will carry out such other relevant duties, as reasonably required
Other Requirements
The role is currently hybrid, predominantly based out of our Leeds office two to three days a week and working from home using Teams, email and video conferencing for our daily stand-ups. It will require the post holder to be motivated, disciplined and able to work under their own initiative.
The candidate will interact with a variety of teams and individuals both internally and externally, therefore should be a strong communicator (both written and verbal), and an effective team player.
We are a friendly and approachable bunch, with a professional approach to our projects. We have a relaxed culture, centred around our tech, the relationships and support we have for one another and getting things right for our clients.

Title: DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer
Job description: We are PhD level researchers, leading engineers and a passionate team of highly experienced Google Shopping specialists striving to build solid scalable systems…
full-description:
Hi there!
We are looking for DevOps Engineers to join us here at Bidnamic.
*
We are PhD level researchers, leading engineers and a passionate team of highly experienced Google Shopping specialists striving to build solid scalable systems to help people find the things they need and want online.
We have undergone hyper growth within the past couple of years and have some exciting new products and services we want to build and incorporate into our SaaS offering.
The role is fully remote within a remote team, with occasional meetups somewhere in the UK (mainly head office in Leeds) or abroad to ensure we still stay connected as a team.
What we're looking for:
Passionate and resourceful engineers that love to Ship!
You have a strong DevOps background and have worked confidently within teams delivering python based data driven systems.
You are comfortable in the ops world (networking, DNS , security, Linux, IP stack etc) and can work with cloud technologies such as AWS/GCP and Terraform.
You have an eye for detail and are not afraid to delve deeper into systematic processes to understand how something is working, doing so releases many ah ha! moments which you thrive off.
You take pride in delivering reliability whilst valuing your time, always striving to eliminate toil.
You are able to give and take in discussions and make tactical decisions to reduce risk when delivering functionality, which is the primary measure of progress.
What you'll be doing:
You will be working closely with our Engineering team to identify, conceptualise, design and deliver code and infrastructural enhancements to our platform.
Ensure the platform continues to operate in a reliable manner for our many clients and internal business users.
Triaging and resolving incoming issues whilst also focusing on how to eliminate any toil.
Using your experience to help us further shape and build out the tooling and processes we need to ensure a healthy and thriving SRE function.
The environment we can offer you:
We don’t follow any specific development methodology per say, we pick and choose the parts from many methodologies that work for us - resulting in a highly lean environment.
We don’t waste time doing anything that adds little or no value, we don’t do “standups” yet have many detailed and focused discussions throughout the day.
We have adopted the concept of "power hours" allowing focused time on your work.
Continued focus on training and development.
Our current tooling:
Python, PostgresSQL, Airflow 2.0, AWS, Terraform, Gitlab, Wrike, Grafana

Title: Full Stack Engineer – Mobile Specialist
Job description:
Build scalable software systems & deal with large datasets.
Andersen EV is seeking a Full Stack Engineer to join our team and take ownership in shaping &…
full-description:
Full Stack Engineer – Mobile Specialist
Andersen EV is seeking a Full Stack Engineer to join our team and take ownership in shaping & building our Kønnect Mobile App.
Apply if
You are excited about the EV revolution. We have established a solid grounding in the EV charging market and need to continuously adapt our product feature set to keep up with the rapid innovation in the industry.
You love delivering a fantastic high-end customer experience. You care about the customer experience to create a highly polished application that matches and exceeds what our customers expect of our products.
You are a self-starter, who loves to learn and grow. You are comfortable with taking initiative and making independent decisions, then communicating back to the team. You enjoy a mix of working on your own and within a team. You keep up with changes in the industry and strive to grow your skills.
You have strong JavaScript & React Native expertise. You’ll be working across our stack and can bring your experience to improve our processes, products and developer experience.
You care about quality and testing. We are constantly improving our developer experience to allow us to move fast whilst maintaining a high level of confidence in our system. You should define and implement best practices and be comfortable seeking and giving thoughtful feedback.
You enjoy being a generalist. We are building our team from a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets, with people who are looking to get the best out of each other. Our engineers are able to contribute across our platform and directly impact the wider success of the company.
About the team
We are building up a new developer-driven team to take our business forward, to match the fast pace of innovation in the sector. You will be joining our team of 5 engineers and have ownership of the Kønnect App.
We work in a cross-discipline manner to allow you to impact our products across the business as the priority demands. This will give you the flexibility to grow your skills outside your specialist area. We use a Kanban workflow with daily stand-ups and a team meeting every 2 weeks. We are keen to only have meetings when necessary to allow you to concentrate on what matters.
You’ll be heavily involved in the end-to-end development process, working closely with our Software Development Manager and Product Manager to scope, design, and deploy innovative new features. You’ll be attentive with a keen eye for detail and delivering clean, scalable code.
We are keen to create the best developer experience within the team and so support you with the latest equipment, tools & access to training such as designcode.io. You can choose between a new M1 Pro – MacBook Pro or a similar system as your preference demands.
Key Responsibilities
Take ownership of your specialist area, maintain its roadmap & prioritisation.
Take a prominent role in the build and testing of new releases.
Build scalable software systems & deal with large datasets.
Find efficient solutions to complex requirements.
Build & design features into our front-end products.
Communicate your ideas, engage with different teams and encourage collaboration.
Create and maintain solid documentation of our systems.
Collaborate with the team to develop across our stack.
Some of our Tech Stack
Infrastructure: AWS
Mobile App: React Native
Internal Tools: Node.js
API: Apollo GraphQL & Restful API
Trade Portal: Next.js
Desirable attributes
This is a mid-level position for someone with 1+ Years’ experience with a lot of room for growth.
Have experience developing scalable, distributed applications, using some or all of the following:
React Native
Swift
Java
Node.js
React
SQL
AWS
Restful Api’s or GraphQL
Experience with mobile development
Experience with CICD & deploying react native apps to IOS & Android
Experience creating & maintaining test suites
Experience with Figma or similar design tools
Experience with Git
Experience with agile working methodologies
Feel comfortable designing, developing, and working with REST APIs and/or Lambda functions
Enjoy taking ownership of features and products from the idea stage to launch
Have a desire to help the world move to a cleaner future!
Have a desire to pick up new skills & leave things better than you found them
Salary & Benefits
£45,000 to £60,000 depending on experience
The equipment you need to get the job done
An opportunity to work on bleeding edge tech in a rapid growth market
Flexible hybrid working
All the learning resources & books you want to aid in personal development
25 days of holiday
Reporting To
Software Development Manager
Job Location
Flexible, our office is London based (Liverpool Street) but you’ll have the autonomy to work wherever suits you. We aim to coordinate our days to be in the office on the same days where possible and have our team meeting in person.
We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage people from all backgrounds, genders, and ethnicities to apply.
About Andersen EV
Andersen EV is a UK manufacturer of stylish charge points for electric vehicles. We blend Scandinavian inspired design with cutting edge innovation. Our unique design features, such as a solution that hides the cable and plug from sight, have helped us secure partnerships with vehicle manufacturers such as Porsche UK. All our intelligent EV charging points are IoT enabled, so customers can track things like their energy usage using our very own mobile application, Kønnect.
Despite a tumultuous 2020 the green revolution continues to surge and the state of play at Andersen EV is no different. We’re looking to grow our Product and Technology team by bringing on some of the best and brightest developers to help us expand our software propositions. You’ll be coming into a great team to develop our next-generation services and constantly improve our experiences. Aside from writing beautiful code, we value good communication and a strong initiative, amongst other things.
The hiring Process
Send in your CV & Cover Letter
Phone call from our Project Manager
Take-home assignment (can be skipped if you have a relevant publicly accessible code repo that you can take us through)
Remote Interview via Microsoft Teams with some of our Engineers
In-person interview & meet the team

Salary: £45,000.00-£60,000.00 per year

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Bachelor's (preferred)

No

Creating new e-commerce websites.
full-description:
Kingfisher Direct is a group of six B2B ecommerce websites that sell commercial and industrial products online.
In 2011 our business began selling products manufactured in a rotational moulding process, including grit bins and water storage containers. It has since grown to over 35,000 products spanning industries like construction, agriculture, manufacturing, warehouses and most recently, PPE.
Over the past year the business has experienced rapid growth and, as such, this fantastic opportunity to join us at an exciting phase in our development has arisen. This is a completely new role within our web development team which will be integral to improving our customers ecommerce experience.
The type of person we’re looking for:
We currently have a fantastic opportunity for a full stack developer to join the team.
This role will draw on a combination of technical knowledge and audience understanding to help us to improve the user experience across all of our six websites. The successful candidate will work to help us combine development and marketing goals to deliver websites optimised for conversion and a seamless user experience.
Following best practice standards, you will implement technical changes to our websites using HTML, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and ensuring the websites reflect the marketing activity for the brands.
You will also be enthusiastic and engaged in UX trends, especially for ecommerce, and will help provide recommendations and implement improvements to our websites based on this understanding.
The main responsibilities include:
Creating new e-commerce websites
Extending, improving and optimizing our existing Magento 2 platform
Working in partnership with marketing and an in-house graphic designer to apply best UX practices
Make sure that our brands are consistently presented across all of our websites
Integrating and implementing software/tools to improve Magento 2 workflows for sales management, customer management, etc.
Website audits and reporting

PHP

Experience working with Progressive Web Apps

Node.js

Excellent time management and organisational skills

Be willing and driven to learn new skills and technology
Ability to commute to our office on a daily basis

Influence over technologies used and workflows
Freedom in selecting tools for your work

Agile development approach
Competitive salary

full-description:
Ruby on Rails Developer
(We require you to be based within easy travelling reach of our Liverpool office)
Who are we?
Founded in 2013, Yozu is a rapidly expanding team of over 25 software and UI/UX developers that help SMEs and larger blue-chip corporations around the UK and abroad to leverage technology better within their business. We work closely with our clients to deliver products and platforms that help to transform their business, and have fun developing innovative solutions to complex problems.
We take a mature approach to agile software development; we automate where possible, we’re agile where and when it matters, we work collaboratively with our clients, and we ship often and early.
Technologies and platforms we utilise include: Rails 5, ES6, Java, ReactJS and React Native, CI via CodeClimate and Bitbucket Pipelines, JIRA, Digital Ocean, Google Cloud, AWS, Git and so on!
On a typical day you will be developing and testing software, fielding questions from clients, updating documentation, refactoring existing code, and designing systems and solutions with the rest of the team.
We require
Enthusiastic and gifted individuals with a proven interest and ability in software development to join our growing team of software engineers. The successful candidate will be helping us develop a number of our products and platforms.
You will be perfect for this role if you are keen to interact with clients from the beginning of a development phase, working alongside a supportive team of junior and senior software development engineers, to produce a clean and effective application.
You should have real-world experience of developing web and/or mobile applications, either in a professional, academic, or personal capacity. Proficiency in languages such as Ruby and Java is also highly desirable.
In return
You will benefit from exposure to some of the latest cutting-edge technologies, and will have the opportunity to see your work used in live production environments for some of the largest companies in the UK.
Improve on your existing skills as you benefit from working with other like-minded individuals who are keen to share their wealth of industry experience and knowledge with you.

Experience working with CSS, familiarity with frameworks such as Bootstrap is a plus.
As a full-stack web developer, you should be comfortable with bringing a mock-up or design to life, including building the user interface and implementing the backend logic.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enthusiastic and motivated personality
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to debug and diagnose in a sensible and methodical manner

full-description:
Overview
We are currently searching for a passionate and talented Software Engineer for continuously integrating ML models and refinements into our product. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with the latest Microsoft technology in highly agile and collaborative engineering and data science teams.
While working at FISCAL, you will be able to develop and enhance your technical skills by utilising the latest technologies and techniques. We will also provide you with the opportunity to broaden your skillset in data science and engineering as this role sits at the interface between both. Our modern, supportive and collaborative working environment provides you with the opportunity to share knowledge and learn new skills, supporting your career and personal growth.
What you’ll be doing…
· Integrating new pipelines and features from research carried out in the data science team into the product based on Microsoft technology stack
· Optimising ML frameworks libraries
· Running datasets and interpreting results to ensure ML models are delivering results to the quality expected
· Actively contributing to sprint planning meetings, stand-ups and end of sprint retrospectives
· Supporting your colleagues and working to achieve common team goals
· Building software based on the Agile principles and practices including Scrum, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
We are looking for someone with…
· 2-3 years demonstrable experience of working with the following technologies: mainly C#, SQL and python (Azure would be advantageous)
· Great communication skills, who enjoys collaborating with a team of talented data scientists and engineers
· Knowledge of developing and expanding unit tests and/or automated test frameworks
· A conscientious and dedicated attitude, who is keen to learn new skills
· Strong problem-solving skills, who can think creatively
What gives you an edge…
· Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and big data tools (Spark, Hadoop)
· Skills in designing AI and Machine Learning systems to automate predictive models
· Previous experience of developing and enhancing SaaS products
· Experience of working in a dynamic Agile software development team
Need any more reasons to work with us?
It’s an exciting time to join FISCAL Technologies as we are expanding which will give you an opportunity to stand out and grow with us.
Established in 2003 and operating in the ‘Fintech’ space, FISCAL has approximately 50 employees, it is an environment where you will have an opportunity to make a big difference, we work hard but have a good time too!
We give back by supporting our chosen charity of the year and hold lots of fun events for employees to take part in. The company has been an award recipient multiple times for being a great place to work and we’re proud to hold a Queen’s award for innovation.

Who on Earth are we?
We are a team, first and foremost. Our team strives to be at the forefront of technological improvements in our business.
We built the number one ranked gadget insurance site, we've developed amazing cutting edge product technology and we're currently working on (amongst many other things) creating the world’s largest consumer brand within it's market.
