Title: Junior .Net Developer
Job description:
Experience delivering systems integration and an excellent understanding of software technologies.
As a Business Systems Developer your focus will be supporting…
full-description:
Not all connections are created equal. Neither are teams.
The Westbase Group is an independent provider of telecommunications equipment and services to the industry. We support our partners across Europe to deliver solutions that connect businesses and their teams.
Our companies – Westbase.io, MS Distribution, Control and Wireless Coverage – all have their unique teams, identities and purposes. Together as a Group though we share a common passion for connected working, the last mile connectivity solutions we deliver, and how they enable businesses to move forwards.
This means that creating a team and environment where every individual can thrive is key to how we work. Both professionally and personally we’re committed to helping every person progress in their chosen career path.
We know that not all teams are created equal, so we work hard to create an environment which is stimulating and inclusive. Our teams are encouraged to take initiative and work together and every employee has the opportunity to make an impact.
Your role.
As a Business Systems Developer your focus will be supporting the development and maintenance of our business tools and eco-system across our group of companies. Working with our Business Systems Owner, you will help map, design and optimise our Systems to meet the groups evolving business needs and provide the tools to meet our strategic goals. A natural problem solver, who focuses on simple solutions that have big impacts, you will be exceptional at understanding process and mapping solutions to support them. An autonomous individual who communicates clearly, you will be accountable for:
Contributing to the development and implementing our business systems strategy
Reviewing and optimising our existing business processes
Creating documentation to support the operational business and the development of new features
Driving maximum value from our business systems investment
Peering with Business Systems Owner to ensure the security of our business systems
Securely providing Customer and 3rd party access to relevant systems information
Focusing on business automation, making our teams as efficient as possible
Integrating systems through the Azure Cloud platform
What you need to have.
To do this job well you need to have:
A passion for delivering solutions to business owners in a fast-paced environment
Excellent problem-solving abilities
Experience delivering systems integration and an excellent understanding of software technologies
An understanding of finance, logistics and other business processes
Office365 skills, particularly advanced Excel, and Power BI (or equivalent)
Good communication skills and stakeholder management skills
Experience of working in high pressure, collaborative environments
Ability to learn on the job as new challenges arise
A proactive attitude with the ability to adapt, and a willingness to take on tasks normally outside your remit – a “roll up your sleeves” approach is desired
2+ years development experience
Experience with C#
The following experience and qualifications are also desirable, but not essential:
Degree-level or equivalent education in Computer Science, IT, or Finance
An understanding of relational databases and schemas
Technical and working knowledge of common integration and scripting methods (SQL, JavaScript, APIs, etc.)
Hands on NetSuite experience including customising workflows and scripting
Understanding of Agile processes, and specifically SAFe which is practiced in the business
We are looking to hire energetic, committed people interested in the tech that we have to offer – and who understand that we perform best when we work together across our company. If this sounds like you, then get in touch.

full-description:
Title: Developer /Coordinator
Job Description:
We are looking for a motivated, passionate individual who has a strong dedication to growing with the company. The applicant must be enthusiastic, highly organized and be open to the many tasks that need to be completed. The candidate will be responsible for the coordination of the development, sourcing and commercialisation of the range. Reporting directly to the directors / designers and working hand and hand with the production manager. This role would also include working on assisting with the studio management and organization.
We are recruiting a Developer to work across several projects. He or She would be involved in direct relations with the manufacturers, mills and trim factories. They would work with the design team to source and develop fabrics, trims and products. We our searching for a candidate that has a strong network of suppliers, manufacturers and contacts across Europe who they can use to find solutions for development. The candidate must be very organized and be able to communicate in a clear and efficient manner. Ideally, the applicant can speak English; Italian and Portuguese is a plus.
Profile:
· Fashion degree diploma required
· 3-4 years’ experience in Luxury and/or Contemporary product development
· Strong analytical skills and business acumen
· Strong organization and coordination skills
· Strong visual communication and presentation skills
· Sensibility to a Luxury & Contemporary product standard and aesthetic
· Fluent in English, proficient in Italian and/or Portuguese beneficial
· Proficient in Adobe Illustrator, Excel, Zedonk and Google drive

· In charge of overseeing and updating collection plans

· Coordinate and update tech packs and product launches

· Oversee the seasonal calendar and make sure everything is on track
· Work directly with the designers to develop their needs
· Work closely with sales directors to ensure all needs are met down the line
· Must work hand in hand with the production manager and make sure the quality and the product’s integrity are respected when reaching the customer
· Create seasonal briefs, help defining needs and new opportunities based on sales - incorporating target SKU counts, price points and margins.
· Assist with generating the seasonal line sheet, costings and pricing strategies for each season
· Participate in Marketing and Sales meeting
· Assist with running and coordinating the studio
· Coordinate between internal team members and make sure all items are being coordinated

ANRA Technologies headquartered in Washington DC with additional offices in London and New Delhi is an international provider of end-to-end drone operations and traffic management solutions for unmanned aircraft operators and airspace managers. These software products offer intelligent and modular traffic management software capabilities for Unmanned Aircraft Systems Traffic Management (UTM) and Urban Air Mobility (UAM, or flying taxis) operations. Title: Software Engineer
Job description:
Experience of embedded software development using small micros EG Atmel-AVR and the.
Experience not important so long as the candidate can demonstrate ability,…
full-description:
Auditel is a British manufacturer of conference systems used by governments and councils throughout the world.
We specialise in fitting hardware and software solutions to our exact customer requirements, creating an exciting environment for innovation and growth.
As a result, our work is often varied, and gives our engineers the opportunity to take full ownership of a project and develop their own solutions to problems.
Auditel's core skill is its engineering and we are at present recruiting for an enthusiastic software engineer capable of Graphical User Interface design. Experience not important so long as the candidate can demonstrate ability, ideally through own software projects.
We have a requirement for a developer preferably with WebRTC knowledge to join our team getting a new software product to market. In addition to this development, duties will include supporting our legacy software which is currently undergoing re-development and assisting or leading new development projects. You will work as part of a small engineering team, and will take ownership of the product.
Our software is primarily Windows based, however knowledge of developing under Linux (Raspberry Pi), Mac, Android and iOS are desirable.
The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate experience of ‘User Interface’ design for applications running under the Windows environment. The role will require some artistic skill in order to develop an appealing, clear and intuitive interface with a Windows ‘look and feel’ to applications controlling parliamentary conference, voting and camera control systems.
Knowledge of Database structures particularly Oracle/MySQL, Delphi/Firemonkey, COM/DCOM, Javascript and WebServices/RESTful are essential. Knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio (C/C++/C# etc) would be an advantage, as would experience of embedded C/C++ development in small micros EG Atmel-AVR.
We offer a friendly environment in which innovation and free thinking are rewarded; in an expanding company opening up opportunities in new market areas. Competitive remuneration and the possibility of international travel are just some of the advantages of a career with Auditel.
Growing areas of interest within the role in the business at present include:
* Multi-channel live audio and even video recording with basic post recording editing and archiving
* Web streaming solutions for live audio video and archived AV, with web front end
* Web-based specialist videoconference platform
* A variety of touchscreen-based systems for solutions within our vertical
Key skills required:
Familiarization with Delphi/Firemonkey (version 7 to current version 10.4.2), Microsoft Visual Studio, C / C++ or C# Languages.
Experience of RDBMS management and programming (Oracle/MySQL).
Ability to work under own initiative, and provide leadership skills for the project and additional software development resources.
Experience of embedded software development using small micros EG Atmel-AVR and the
WinAVR GCC compiler will be beneficial for future projects.
The applicant needs to be very-much a Hands On engineer.
Other Requirements:
A Valid Passport, UK driving license and ability to travel when needed.
Career Level:
Senior (Self Motivated, able to manage one’s self)

Casual dress

8 hour shift

Title: Lead Web Developer
Job description: Deep understanding of factors affecting end-to-end software development, particularly commercial implications of implementation and change.
full-description:
Lead Web Developer
Warrantywise are one of the fastest-growing businesses in the Northwest, an award-winning warranty company that continually rank as one of the best businesses in Lancashire. We are looking for a high-performing Lead Full Stack Web Developer to join our ever-growing team, at our prestigious office, The Rocket Center in Blackburn.
What does the role involve?
You will be required to work across our full brand portfolio to ensure the best-in-class technical standards are implemented throughout. Your Key Responsibilities will be;
Understanding project requirements and how to convert customer/business requirements into technical and non-technical requirement.
Handling the priority of issue fixing and feature development.
Organizing show and tell demonstrations with relevant stakeholders.
Working with the CTO and wider team to help improve technology and ways of working.
Ensure that technical approach follows guidelines and allows for future project requirements.
Ensure the CTO is kept up to date with technical reports of project progress, and that he is consulted when technical decisions are made.
Exhibit clear communication and willingness to support other team members and departments.
Deep understanding of factors affecting end-to-end software development, particularly commercial implications of implementation and change.
Design and implement aspects of development with limited guidance, with the ability to justify and explain coherently.
Be the technical lead for assigned projects and manage these through the software development life cycle including creation of project documentation like task tickets, architectural diagrams, help documentation and decision logs etc.
Mentoring other team members in your area of expertise.
Knowledge & Skills needed
Significant experience of using PHP, MySQL and Laravel and JavaScript (Preferably Vue.js)
Understand OOP, MVC and associated best practices.
Experience designing and consuming RESTful APIs.
Excellent knowledge of responsive UI development, HTML5 and Bootstrap.
Working knowledge of AWS autoscaling cloud service.
Good understanding of version control tools, preferably Git.
Demonstrable experience in designing, developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of tooling and task runners e.g Composer, npm and grunt etc.
Knowledge of Linux based systems and comfortable with the Linux command line.
What we are looking for
An experienced developer, with a passion for coaching and mentoring. Who will be able to help define and shape what we do and the way we do it. We are looking for some who is able to introduce new technologies and industry best practices.
And who is able to work on a number of business-critical applications at any one time. You will also be working to improve the technical function of the business and lead by example when it comes to collaborating with the team on both new and existing projects.
Benefits
Lead Developer upto £45,000 depending on experience.
20 days holiday plus bank holidays.
Increases to 22 days holiday after 5 years of service.
1 month paid sabbatical after 10 years of service.
Company pension.
Company supported healthcare (Free eye test, offer Able Futures support service).
30% discount on all warranty products for employees, friends and family.
Interest free company loan up to £1000 (After 6 months of service).
Excellent working environment.
Recommend a friend scheme.
Staff incentives.
Social events.
Progression within the company.
This is a full time role, Monday to Friday between 09.00am and 17.00pm. Hybrid working available.

Title: PHP Developer
Job description: MyWorkwear is looking for a Web Developer with experience working full-stack (PHP, JavaScript, jQuery etc) who, working closely with an experienced IT Leader…
full-description:
About the role
MyWorkwear is looking for a Web Developer with experience working full-stack (PHP, JavaScript, jQuery etc) who, working closely with an experienced IT Leader and other developers, will help shape our in-house systems and our high traffic e-commerce website.
We are an ambitious, fast-growing business and technology is at the centre of our strategy to continue our growth.
This role would suit a Developer who thrives in an autonomous working environment and who relishes the challenge of converting business requirements into technical solutions with the drive to work independently to achieve results.
You will report to one of the company directors who has a background as a web developer; together you will build performant, usable systems and sometimes push technical boundaries to find new and exciting ways to stay ahead of the game, creating efficiency savings or driving more sales for the business.
Based in Telford we offer a modern workspace but are also happy to offer long term remote working or a hybrid of both remote and in-office if preferred, you will be required to attend the office for occasional meetings and events.
You will ideally be based in the West Midlands and you should have most of the following key skills:
Strong OO PHP experience
Database design (MySQL etc)
Git version control experience
Demonstrable ability to convert business ideas into technical solutions
Web Services exposure
Front end understanding – HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
The ability to work independently to produce high quality, maintainable, well-documented code
In return, you can expect a starting salary of £28,000 - £35,000 dependent on experience, with long term remote working available if required and a real commitment to personal development within a high growth, market-leading company.
About Us
MyWorkwear is one of the UK’s leading suppliers of embroidered and printed clothing. Based in Telford, Shropshire, we have modernised a long-established business with significant investment into our in-house systems and website to create a competitive advantage that has led to significant growth over the last few years.
Our skilled team produce thousands of garments per week, supplying companies, large and small, from across the UK. As a tech-driven business, we combine our in-house technology with industry-leading embroidery and heat transfer machines to brand uniforms for clients as diverse as Vimto, Oxford University and the NHS.
As a small friendly team, we aim to provide the highest level of customer service, quality products and great value every day, by putting our customers' needs at the heart of everything we do.
At MyWorkwear we provide a fantastic working environment for all our staff. We strive to be a friendly and inclusive workplace and have a diverse team of people who share a passion for providing excellent service and quality workwear.
Our aim is for MyWorkwear to be a place where people want to come to work and given some team members have been with us for over 30 years, we think it may well be true.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job description:
The role will involve working with C#, Web API's (using SharePoint API's to query data such as, REST APIs, and CSOM).
Maintaining and upgrading older projects.
full-description:
Job Purpose:
Peninsula are hiring a Full Stack Developer to join an existing team and work on new and existing applications that are used across the Peninsula Group. These applications are bespoke, complex, and are of great importance to the day to day running of the business. If you are looking for a role where your work will have meaningful impact on hundreds of users, where you will work in an established SharePoint team, and where you will be employed by a company who will support you and develop your skills, this is the position for you.
Job Overview:
At Peninsula, we are a consultancy specialising in Employment Law and Health and Safety Advice. What this means is that we partner with SMEs and make sure they are complying with the law so they can do what they love - namely getting on with running their business. With the flexibility of working from our modern offices in Manchester and working from home when needed, you'll be working on SharePoint Projects which will play a big part in our future growth. The role will involve working with C#, Web API's (using SharePoint API's to query data such as, REST APIs, and CSOM). and working with Angular at times for our front-end applications. This is all working in both an on-premise SharePoint Farm and Cloud based solutions using Azure.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities:
Working in an agile team.
Designing, developing, and maintaining Web applications.
Working with closely with BA and QA to understand requirements and give estimates.
Working with other developers to help deliver products that cross teams.
Providing development support to internal and external users, to ensure stable service,
Staying up to date on current technologies and techniques.
Building greenfield projects, in latest technologies to suite business needs.
Maintaining and upgrading older projects.
Working with the SharePoint team in an Agile environment to design, develop and maintain complex and bespoke web applications.
Working closely with BAs, QAs and other developers.
Proactively suggest new tools and technologies which will support the development strategies and goals.
Providing development level support to our internal and external users to ensure stable delivery of our services.
Requirements:
Each of the skills listed below are ideal but not essential:
Background in C#:
Knowledge of cloud-based providers, Azure/AWS/GCP.
Having previously worked within an Agile Development environment.
Familiar with:
Front end technologies, Angular, HTML, Typescript, CSS.
Office 365 Development (Add ins, Power platform).
Net C#, AngularJS, JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
InfoPath and SQL server.
Web services using C#.
Experience with:
Experience with SharePoint framework.
Experience with SharePoint CSOM, REST, SSOM.
Experience Delivering and Maintaining Web APIs,
Experience with .net Framework/ core.
Experience with Agile development environment.
Experience working with a team.
Experience of unit testing frameworks.
Experience working within the SharePoint Object Model and with scripting using PowerShell.
Building Web services using C#.
What we can offer you:
Flexible working available.
Fantastic workplace in Manchester city centre.
Working with talented people with opportunities to always learn.
Dynamic fast paced environment.
Commercially driven and successful.
No boundaries to development.
Some of our Benefits:
Generous Annual Leave.
Additional Day off for your Birthday.
Christmas Bonus of 1 weeks' pay (after established length of service).
Eye Care Contribution (£20 towards test and £36.50 towards glasses).
Pension Scheme 3%, 5% and 7% Schemes.

Job description: Closely working with our producers, coders, graphic designers, and digital artists you’ll help us create, modify and maintain projects across a range of scope…
full-description:
Pikcells are award winning creators of CG images and interactive web based projects working with a global network of clients in the home interiors and furniture industry. We employ about 30 energetic and innovative people who share our vision to be the best at what we do and have fun doing it.
We’re looking for a talented Javascript 3D developer to join our team to help produce unique and engaging web experiences.
We work on a broad range of tools and products where 3D technology converges with web applications. You will get to work with the latest VR, AR, web tools as well as building next generation product configurators.
This is a unique opportunity to be part of a dynamic, talented and fast growing company where your ideas and contributions make a real difference.
You’ll be working in an environment where visual quality is key. Closely working with our producers, coders, graphic designers, and digital artists you’ll help us create, modify and maintain projects across a range of scope and budgets.
Your responsibilities will include helping build progressively enhanced and responsive WebXR / 3D / 2D web applications running in WebGL frameworks [threejs/babylon etc.]. These must run on a range of hardware from low powered mobile devices to high-end VR gaming PCs.
The work will be constantly evolving and varied, usually requiring a number of unique solutions to be designed for each project. It’s never boring.
Job Responsibilities
Building, developing and maintaining new and existing online experiences
Work closely with our R&D team to develop interactive 3D and 2D web-based products
Producing well-documented and beautifully crafted solutions using emerging web technologies [WebXR/Canvas/ES6]
Be able to learn and use new APIs, SDKs or programming languages as necessary
Collaborate with producers, coders, graphic designers, and digital artists to build high quality/performance web applications
Be willing to explore opportunities enabled by new technologies
Research, analyse and explain possible approaches to unique problems

Demonstrable experience with Web APIs, especially WebGL, WebXR and Canvas
One or two years of Javascript 3D [three.js etc.] experience or 3D experience in other programming languages
Comfortable working with various build and task automation tools, including Webpack, Gulp, Grunt
An interest in online web technologies

GLSL experience
Video game industry experience
Good understanding of GIT and approaches to version control
Amateur or Professional game development experience
Knowledge of Game Engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal etc).
Cross browser and Cross device development

Title: BI Developer
Job description: You’ll contribute to the success of the organisation by designing, developing and delivering Business Intelligence solutions; from eliciting and defining…
full-description:
The Role
We’re recruiting a BI Developer to join our Technology & Transformation team – we’re a data hungry organisation where tracking, managing and reporting on our performance information is really important. As a BI Developer you’re critical in enabling us to achieve our mission of ‘Making What Matters Brilliant’, by assisting our organisation to better understand its reporting needs and steering its requirements!
You’ll contribute to the success of the organisation by designing, developing and delivering Business Intelligence solutions; from eliciting and defining stakeholder needs, to delivering solutions and ongoing support and maintenance. You will be influential in identifying the correct platform and tools to deliver data warehousing, analytic platforms and visualisation tools, requiring you to keep abreast of the latest technology related to BI and be able to suggest and support change as necessary. A key part of role this is interfacing with internal stakeholders throughout the lifecycle of cyclical projects; being the technical expert in the project team and presenting demos of tools and platforms.
You’ll join our small but mighty BI team at a time where we’re migrating to Azure, so you can expect to get involved in developing the proof of concept as well as ongoing development and delivery of Cloud solutions.
Our ideal candidate? We welcome applications from innovative and delivery focused individuals with:
Experience of data warehousing and an understanding of ETL processes
Familiar with Power BI data models and reports, including DAX, and Cloud BI tools
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Experience of delivering projects in an Agile framework
Ability to engage confidently with all levels of stakeholders, to translate and communicate technical themes into understandable solutions.
Who are Midland Heart? We’re a large and ambitious housing organisation providing more people an affordable place to call home. We welcome people from every walk of life, at every stage of their career. We expect a lot from our people but in return you can be assured of a great place to work, where you will be well rewarded and where great people are able to succeed. Whether you want to build your career with us, or use your experience to move on, we’re here to develop your potential.
Interested? Click on "Candidate Information" below for a full Role Profile. Applying is easy - simply register on our candidate portal uploading a CV and Covering Letter, which show us that you have what it takes to make a success of the role.
Applications close at midnight on Sunday 09th January 2022.
We’re proud to be a Disability Confident Employer. Please feel free to contact us if you would like to discuss any adjustments you might need in order to be successful in this role.

full-description:
Parkingeye is an advanced provider of a wide range of parking solutions to support businesses whilst working ethically with our motorists. We offer smart, flexible and integrated carpark management solutions to help increase parking revenue, reduce car park abuse and improve customer satisfaction.
We are recruiting for an experienced Business Intelligence Developer to welcome into our vibrant and busy IT team. Reporting into the Head of IT Operations you will be responsible for servicing management, business and client reporting requirements. Identifies problems, managing to resolution.
Investigative nature.

Must be pro-active and able to multi-task within a busy working environment
Strong interpersonal skills, flexibility, self-motivation, and enthusiasm are essential, as is the ability to meet deadlines.
Working hours will be Monday to Friday, 07:30am to 17:00pm. Flexibility with working hours are essential as overtime will be required from time to time.
The Candidate
To be considered for our clients Offline Programmer/Technical Assistant role, you will have the following skills and experience:
Qualifications
Formal training for CNC programing software such as WoodWOP desirable but not essential as training can be given.
Able to read and interpreted technical drawings and specifications
Experience
Knowledge of CNC programing preferably within a sheet material production setting desirable.
Knowledge of general engineering and manufacturing processes.
If you feel you have the skills for the Offline Programmer/Technical Assistant, please apply now!

Title: Blender Developer/Animator
Job description: They must familiarise themselves with software used for team management and accept tasks through the software, recording their acceptance, stage completion and…
full-description:
Company description
Technically Creative is one of the UK’s leading Visitor Attraction Experience Designers and Producers. We specialise in Experiential, Audio Visual, Interactive and Scenic projects. We are looking for talented people to expand our first-class team. We work with some of the world's most exciting organisations, brands and IP’s including the Warner Bros, Yorkshire Wildlife Park, Crystal Maze, Eden Camp, Hasbro and many more. Our working life is anything but boring to say the very least! if you want to work on some of the most innovative and inspiring experiential projects around, come and join us!
Technically Creative Ltd is looking for a full-time Artist and Animator capable of working in both 2D and 3D. The applicant must be legally entitled to work in the United Kingdom and have a home address in the United Kingdom. Our Creative Technologies department designs, prototypes, manufactures and installs all types of Interactive immersive experiences including special effects, lighting, AV and visual experiences for all sorts of attractions and theme parks installations. We offer a complete in house solution, programming, media and show control systems, lighting effects, interactive electronics and audio systems.
Job Description
The successful applicant must be capable of working in both 2D and 3D. They will be involved in the production of animated assets including characters, icons, environments, visual effects, concept artwork and experiential worlds and must be capable of working in multiple different art styles including but not limited to realistic, semi-realistic and manga styles. They will be responsible for work across multiple stages from initial concept sketches to polished full production assets and work in both high poly and low poly formats, optimising models for best performance and adhering to poly count or texture size restrictions.
They must be capable of creating assets based on general and specific briefs, to meet the requirements of the clients. They will be responsible for creating initial 2D sketches and concept art and designs, as well as creating 3D models of concept sketches.
They must be capable of working alone or with team members and must manage their time and work priority appropriately and be prepared to work from a verbal brief when given, asking for extra detail if needed. They must familiarise themselves with software used for team management and accept tasks through the software, recording their acceptance, stage completion and delivery. They must be capable of breaking larger tasks down into multiple tasks and must be capable of posting and organising these tasks on team management software. They must be capable of producing high quality character and object rigging and animation and assisting in the production and animation of assets from other programmers, collaborating to ensure consistency and compatibility.
They should be an expert with 3D modelling software such as Blender, as well as other industry standard tools such as Photoshop and Premiere and other open-source software. The applicant must also be familiar working with Unity or other game engines.
They should have a good knowledge of shaders and materials and will be required to work with and design them, to achieve the required art style in the game. They must have a strong understanding of lighting principles. They must be capable of producing clean and easy to work with UV and texture maps
Key Responsibilities
Character concept art
3D character models, rigging and animation
3D Object and Environments
3D effects and animations.
Design and develop all sorts of hands-on interactive games, exhibits and experiences from design briefs and client scopes.
Work from outline customer briefs and design specifications, to produce functional practical solutions.
The Successful Applicant must be/Have
Diploma of Higher Education (preferred)
Experience: 3D Artist or Video Game Artist and Animator: 1 year (preferred)
Person Specification
You must have a positive approach to problem solving
Be local to our head office in Elvington, York
You must thrive under pressure, be driven to deliver success, be organised, logical, methodical, creative, artistic and confident to try alternatives
Be keen to self-learn emerging technology, be innovative in the application of solutions to arising challenges
More importantly you must love working in a team and have good communication and interpersonal skills and have sound decision making skills
Must have a valid Passport and be willing and flexible to travel to international locations, as well as the UK
What we’re looking for
We’re looking for an ambitious Blender artist and animator who has previous experience who wants to join a progressive team at our head office in York.

Senior Full Stack Web Developer
We are looking for a Full Stack Web Developer to join us, supporting us to build our bespoke in-house software. Cavalry Healthcare operates as a family-run provider of Complex Care provider and temporary staffing recruitment agency, supporting care organisations across the North West!
What does the role involve?
You will be required to work across our full brand portfolio to ensure the best-in-class technical standards are implemented throughout. You will need to carry out;
· CRM development.
· Software Engineering.
· Building web applications with cutting edge PHP, Laravel, Vue & JavaScript frameworks.
· Maintaining and improving our various quote systems, API's, internal CRM and B2B portals.
· Deploying to cloud hosted servers on AWS EC2 & Elastic Beanstalk.
· Working with Git managed code bases with production, testing and development environments.
What we are looking for
We want someone hardworking, committed to the role, and is technically confident. You will need a solid understanding of CRM development, Software engineering, MVC architecture and object-orientated programming, as well as experience working with PHP and JavaScript frameworks such as Laravel/Vue.js.
You need to be confident in implementing responsive web designs with HTML and CSS. An excellent level of attention to detail and a good eye for debugging is vital.
The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years minimum experience.

· 20 days holiday plus bank holidays.

· Progression within the company.

Title: Software Developer - full time
Job description:
You are familiar with Agile software development practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming, sprints, or user stories.
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays).
full-description:
Software Developer
Ever thought about writing code for racing yachts or cutting-edge medical devices? Dreamt of working on globally recognised, award-winning products? Or wished you worked just minutes from the beach?
At Bluefruit, that’s what we do.
Recognised worldwide for the quality of our code and our Agile practices, clients come to us for reliable, innovative solutions. And with the current explosive growth in the embedded and IoT industry, demand for our services gets bigger every day. That’s why we’re looking for outstanding software engineers to join our teams across a number of exciting new projects.
About you
We’re looking for passionate, open-minded programmers of all experience levels — and you’re looking for technically-challenging software projects and a workplace full of intelligent, friendly people.
You have C or C++ programming skills, can debug faults and use version control. You are familiar with Agile software development practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming, sprints, or user stories. It would be great if you also have recent industry experience.
If you are interested in applying for a senior position, we would also be looking for you to have specific technical expertise. For example, your expertise may be embedded microcontrollers, AI, or User Interface development, and so on. Plus, you would be expected to have the ability to coach more junior team members and be able to take the lead on delivering projects.
To be part of Bluefruit, you should demonstrate that you are a keen problem solver, you enjoy working to a very high standard, communicate effectively, and want to work as part of a high-performing team.
Formal academic qualifications aren’t required, but your programming skills should be second to none. For our senior positions, experience of embedded systems (working with PIC, ARM or AVR architectures, for example) is a big plus.
…and us
At Bluefruit, we don’t just talk about work/life balance – we actively encourage it. From flexible working hours, to letting our people create their own working environment, we work hard to ensure everyone here enjoys coming into work.
We are committed to providing training for everyone in the company to realise their potential. Our company was created by engineers for engineers and, as an EOT company, it’s important to us that all our people have a say in how we develop our business.
Our culture is built around an unerring focus on delivering high-quality code for intelligent products that users love and clients value. We encourage efficient and open communication, and shared responsibility for design and implementation. And we review each other’s work all the time – everyone at Bluefruit constantly seeks out opportunities to learn and improve.
We’re privileged to live in one of the most beautiful parts of the UK – and we all want time to enjoy it, so we focus on flexi-time, not overtime. We also offer a range of benefits, including:
EOT profit-related bonus – tax-free up to £3,600 per year
Regular salary reviews
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
Flexitime available for all employees
Onsite Gym
Free fruit, tea and coffee and year-round ice creams in the summer
Chill out room with pool table
Great maternity and paternity leave benefits
Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
Healthcare cashback scheme
Free access to a financial planner
Cycle to work scheme
Salary - up to £45,000 per year depending on experience
Schedule - Monday to Friday. Part time applications will be considered.
Sound good?
Send us your CV today and we’ll invite you to our Cyber Dojo to complete an online coding exercise.
Please note: Our offices are based in Redruth, Cornwall and currently all employees are expected to work in the office at least part of the week.
All applicants must have the right to live and work in the UK.

Wenso is currently recruiting SAS Programmers/Analysts to join a new SAS team. This role will see the candidate working on SAS Project focusing on SAS Development. The ideal candidate will have had exposure to work closely alongside the Data Management, Finance MI and Change Management teams. Understanding and explaining the technical aspects of each segments financial information and the effectiveness.

Extensive experience in the development and review of SAS programs for management and reporting.

Strong SAS DI studio, BASE & Macro skills SQL skills, ideally in Redshift or similar MPP database
Good experience in BI data warehouse ETL build, particularly focusing on presentation layer, deriving values based on business rules

BASE SAS programs, SAS procedures, or standardized macros.
Knowledge of MS Excel, SAS, SAS EG, SAS/STAT, SAS/MACROS.

full-description:
Thovex Ltd, founded in 2019, is a software company building Landstack — a Software as a service (SaaS) platform that is aiming to become the digital infrastructure which the land and development industry will use to work more efficiently and effectively. If you are interested in working with a team solving complex problems in order to drastically improve how an industry works, from the bottom up, this might be the role for you.
We are looking for a Full-Stack Web Developer with some industry experience to join our small team of developers. Examples of work would be:
1- Working with improving connections to our data collection system — a large project built in python running on servers hosted on AWS. This involves improving and maintaining the control system that manages the web scrapers and web crawlers we use to gather information, working with our internal APIs to ensure information is updated efficiently, working with our data team to ensure information is up to standard and building automated solutions to improve the efficiency and accuracy of the data.
2 - Improving the backend infrastructure that the main website and service runs on. This might include a transition to cloud infrastructure, horizontally scaling our servers or a move to a API-based infrastructure.
3 - Building new features into our platform for our users to use. Ranging from speed and efficiency improvements of existing features to completely new additions to the platform.
An ideal candidate would be within a commutable distance of Cirencester, Gloucestershire and would be able to commit either a full time or a hybrid working schedule. With hybrid being 3 - 4 days in office and 1 - 2 days working remotely from home. Good locations are Cheltenham, Gloucester, Swindon. You would be expected to work 37.5 hours a week. We have core work hours of 10:30 - 3:30, with the rest of the time each week filled in to suit your working preference.
This is a full time position, with 20 days paid holiday a year (excl bank holidays). Salary is £35,000-£45,000 depending on experience.
Essential:
* Strong knowledge of Javascript, PHP, HTML, CSS
* Good experience with the Laravel framework, preferably with Laravel 5+
* Object Oriented based development experience
Desirable:
* Comfortable in SSH/terminal access
* Linux experience * MySQL/Postgresql knowledge
* Experience using REST services
* Experience in using Sass
* Experience using Git/SVC
* Good experience with the Laravel framework
* Basic experience of AWS or similar server management providers.
Useful:
* Comfortable with using Mac OS
* Experience with GIS and GeoSpatial data
* Experience with Open layers
* Experience using Geoserver

Title: iOS Developer
Job description: You’ll need to work with Swift and Objective C and have a good understanding of the interface builder and auto layout.
full-description:
Manchester City Centre
Salary on offer upto £45,000 DOE

Who are we?
BrightHR is a people management software company and we are looking for the most driven and dedicated developers to join our team. We offer a software as a service solution that enables businesses to effortlessly implement HR processes, from approving holidays, logging sickness and tracking lateness, managing the workforce rota & shifts, and organising HR documents 24 hours a day 365 days a year.

Who are we looking for?
We have a great product team here at BrightHR that believes in user-centered design, iterative development and validated learning. We work in an agile and collaborate way in cross-functional teams focusing on delivering value not just to a UK audience but to international clients across 4 platforms.

You’ll need to work with Swift and Objective C and have a good understanding of the interface builder and auto layout. You’ll understand REST, JSON and be building clean architecture with TDD and BDD, if you know VIPER that’s a bonus and you’ll need to know XCode UI Testing. Most of all, we are looking for passionate mobile developers who love what they do and want to build amazing apps.

The demand for our services has meant has led to the creation of a new team, new opportunities for growth and new features to work on.

What’s in it for you?
In return we offer you a fantastic workplace with all the support you need to grow as a professional working with some of the best! With regular social events and a generous benefits package, we believe in making sure our employees know how brilliant we think they are.

If this sounds like the role for you then click apply today!

Title: Software Engineer
Job description:
Experience of embedded software development using small micros EG Atmel-AVR and the.
Experience not important so long as the candidate can demonstrate ability,…
full-description:
Auditel is a British manufacturer of conference systems used by governments and councils throughout the world.
We specialise in fitting hardware and software solutions to our exact customer requirements, creating an exciting environment for innovation and growth.
As a result, our work is often varied, and gives our engineers the opportunity to take full ownership of a project and develop their own solutions to problems.
Auditel's core skill is its engineering and we are at present recruiting for an enthusiastic software engineer capable of Graphical User Interface design. Experience not important so long as the candidate can demonstrate ability, ideally through own software projects.
We have a requirement for a developer preferably with WebRTC knowledge to join our team getting a new software product to market. In addition to this development, duties will include supporting our legacy software which is currently undergoing re-development and assisting or leading new development projects. You will work as part of a small engineering team, and will take ownership of the product.
Our software is primarily Windows based, however knowledge of developing under Linux (Raspberry Pi), Mac, Android and iOS are desirable.
The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate experience of ‘User Interface’ design for applications running under the Windows environment. The role will require some artistic skill in order to develop an appealing, clear and intuitive interface with a Windows ‘look and feel’ to applications controlling parliamentary conference, voting and camera control systems.
Knowledge of Database structures particularly Oracle/MySQL, Delphi/Firemonkey, COM/DCOM, Javascript and WebServices/RESTful are essential. Knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio (C/C++/C# etc) would be an advantage, as would experience of embedded C/C++ development in small micros EG Atmel-AVR.
We offer a friendly environment in which innovation and free thinking are rewarded; in an expanding company opening up opportunities in new market areas. Competitive remuneration and the possibility of international travel are just some of the advantages of a career with Auditel.
Growing areas of interest within the role in the business at present include:
* Multi-channel live audio and even video recording with basic post recording editing and archiving
* Web streaming solutions for live audio video and archived AV, with web front end
* Web-based specialist videoconference platform
* A variety of touchscreen-based systems for solutions within our vertical
Key skills required:
Familiarization with Delphi/Firemonkey (version 7 to current version 10.4.2), Microsoft Visual Studio, C / C++ or C# Languages.
Experience of RDBMS management and programming (Oracle/MySQL).
Ability to work under own initiative, and provide leadership skills for the project and additional software development resources.
Experience of embedded software development using small micros EG Atmel-AVR and the
WinAVR GCC compiler will be beneficial for future projects.
The applicant needs to be very-much a Hands On engineer.
Other Requirements:
A Valid Passport, UK driving license and ability to travel when needed.
Career Level:
Senior (Self Motivated, able to manage one’s self)

Salary: £40,000.00-£45,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Flexible schedule

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Midweight PHP (Laravel) Developer. What's your point of Vue?
Job description:
Some bean bags and a table tennis table.
We have a great plan for zapping inefficiency and wastage in an old-school industry.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.
full-description:
Indiana Jones is looking for stuff then suddenly he’s running from a bloody great big boulder. Final-act stuff in most movies, but Raiders began with a bang and ramped it up from there.
Well, that’s what this job is like, except it won’t end with your face melting or propellers slicing your head off (hopefully).
We’re a small, friendly and collaborative bunch. It’s your typical small office business really. A few rows of desks and laptops. Some bean bags and a table tennis table. And some sweets on reception.
We have a great plan for zapping inefficiency and wastage in an old-school industry. It’s not glamorous. It’s not Biotech or Fintech. (We’ll think of a cool term right after we sort those sweets.) But it is leading-edge stuff in the business intelligence, analytics and market insight space. And if you have a strong sense of community so much the better.
We’re not looking for newbies. You’re a raw, hungry developer who wants to be trained and nurtured? Good luck – but sorry, see ya. We need a senior developer who can hit the ground running and deliver from day one.
You won’t find any prima donnas here. Our world is full of deadlines that must be met. Stop press is simply not an option. Stress levels inevitably rise as these deadlines approach so you’ll need to be comfortable working under pressure and adept at keeping those plates spinning.
Must-have exposure? Vue.js, PHP (Laravel). For you, software isn’t a job, it’s a craft. You’ve got a GitHub repository. You’re involved in meetups, forums etc. You own a hat and a whip (optional).
Culture is as important to us as it is to you. If you thrive in client-facing environments, enjoy interacting with both technical and non-technical audiences and love nothing more than taking an idea from mere concept to actual implementation then you’ll fit right in.
We’re evolving, pivoting quickly, chucking out stuff that doesn’t work. We’re surrounded by coffee shops so we’ll be brainstorming in those.
And the £££ isn’t your usual startup peanuts. We are looking at up to £65,000 plus benefits.
Interested to know more? get that CV and covering letter to us. No covering letter, no good. And don’t look at the Ark!
Reference ID: MGTX
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: Up to £65,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Job description: At present all of our development is outsourced and the role will therefore suit a talented and ambitious individual who is looking to make their mark in a…
full-description:
We are a well established ecommerce business based in Glasgow city centre. We are looking to recruit a PHP/Magento front-end developer to work under the direction of our ecommerce manager and alongside our external developers to implement a development strategy focussed on growing, enhancing and maximising the opportunities available.
At present all of our development is outsourced and the role will therefore suit a talented and ambitious individual who is looking to make their mark in a dynamic SME. The role will suit self-motivated and self-starting individuals who are prepared to think strategically as well as technically and prepared to be creative, brave and opinionated.
Whilst the role will involve a degree of lone working, the ability to work collaboratively is essential to the success of the role and for the successful candidate to become a significant player within the business.
The business is over 15 years old and has a strong track record that this individual will help build upon, ensuring that we offer a best in class ecommerce experience to our existing and new customers. We have a number of exciting new projects in the pipeline, including new webstores, products and expanding our existing core range. We are therefore looking to fill this role to drive these projects forward.
PHP experience is essential, with previous Magento 2 experience desirable. We are looking for candidates who will have either worked in an in-house ecommerce environment or within an external agency and who are ready and motivated to make a mark in a role with lots of long term potential.
A competitive salary with performance bonus, flexibility and other perks will be offered, with longer term progression to profit share/equity available. Whilst the role will likely suit mid-level developers, we will consider all levels of seniority for the right individual.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job description: Our digital products include a virtual/hybrid event platform, a 3D storytelling platform and collaborative apps for brainstorming and workshopping.
full-description:
Working at Platform is fun, exciting, and dynamic. Our digital products include a virtual/hybrid event platform, a 3D storytelling platform and collaborative apps for brainstorming and workshopping.
Full Stack Developer
Brighton, BN1 1AL
£45,000 - £60,000
Hybrid Working
Please note: Applicants must be eligible to work in the UK
About us:
At Platform, we connect brands and people through insight led design and technology, working world-wide for some of the biggest brands on the planet.
We are looking to expand our digital team to help develop our applications. You’ll be working with a diverse team of developers, designers, strategic thinkers and passionate people. You’ll get the chance to shape the development paths of the applications and be part of a great team, as well as getting the chance to meet and work with client teams.
About you:
We are looking for problem solvers, not just people who know how to write code. You need to be able to deconstruct large customer journeys and user requirements, into smaller user story led component style architectures working towards overall clean, scalable architectures.
You should have a good understanding of API design and third-party API consumption methodologies, as well as a good understanding of optimisation and performance improvement techniques.
Not all our development is web focused, some is hardware management, so an interest in large scale AV management and processing is a bonus.
The role:
The role requires a good understanding of typical full stack JavaScript deployments where the correct back and front-end technologies are applied for each individual project. Knowing how the JavaScript ecosystems are evolving is key so you know what technologies to apply to any given set of requirements.
Ideally you should have consultancy experience, be comfortable liaising and leading client discussions as well as communicating well across internal teams.
Managing GCP services and understanding Firebase are a bonus though solid experience of microservices and distributed systems would suffice.
As Full Stack Developer, you will be:
Developing and maintaining all server-side network components.
Ensuring optimal performance of databases and responsiveness to front-end requests.
Collaborating with front-end developers on the integration of elements.
Designing back-end services for various business processes.
Developing high-performance applications by writing testable, reusable, and efficient code.
Implementing effective security protocols, data protection measures, and storage solutions.
Running diagnostic tests, repairing defects, and providing technical support.
Recommending and implementing improvements to processes and technologies.
Keeping informed of advancements in the field of Node.js development.
The ideal Full Stack Developer will have:
At least three years' experience as a Node.js developer.
Extensive knowledge of JavaScript and MongoDB.
Track record of building well defined and scalable RESTful APIs.
Can demonstrate sound security principles and scalable security API design.
Knowledge of front-end web technologies (we use Vue).
A good understanding of GCP or AWS including deployment methodologies.
Solid understanding of Firebase including Firestore, Firebase Auth and Firebase Functions.
Micro service architecture build and deployment experience.
Why come and work with us
If you're looking for a role that is out of the ordinary, this is the place to come.
As part of a team that works on exciting projects, with some of the world’s premier brands, you will have the opportunity to develop your career path, work with creatives and help shape the direction of our digital team.
Benefits include:
Flexible working at home and in the office.
25 days holiday.
Contributory pension.
Free tea, coffee and fruit in the office.
Professional development / training budget for all staff members.
How to apply for the Full Stack Developer role:
If you have the skills and experience required for this position, click “apply” today andcheck your inbox for an email providing more information on how to tailor your application and provide a cover letter or any supporting documents.
You must be eligible to work in the UK.
Other suitable skills and experience includes web developer, software engineer, software developer, front end developer, network engineer, IOS developer, data engineer, programmer, senior software engineer, senior programmer, senior developer

Title: Experienced Web Developer - Ruby on Rails

full-description:
Job Description
Experienced Web Developer - Ruby on Rails
Part of the GreenED Group and sister company to Go Green Managed Services, Green-MAC and BigPAWZ Productions. Join the team at SmartED-iTORS
We're looking for an enthusiastic Web Developer with a drive to improve their development skills and knowledge in the field. The role will consist of working closely with the lead developers to understand customer needs with the aim of transforming their concepts into seamless digital experiences. In addition to developing new concepts you will also be required to work on existing legacy software which will include bug resolution, feature implementation as well as general maintenance.
An integral part of the development process involves a high percentage of application test coverage, ensuring all key aspects and features of the apps are functioning as expected, this will be a key aspect of the role, ensuring future features and applications employ strict TDD principles.
You’ll need to be comfortable working autonomously and as part of a team, as you’ll be taking part in the majority of the development lifecycle, working on potentially complex builds while collaborating with the customer and other individuals within the development team.
All of our software is written in Ruby on Rails which is a key aspect to the role, experience with this language and framework is essential as well as demonstrating the ability to learn and advance in the language.
Requirements
· Web - Knowledge of web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
· Code - Competent in key coding concepts (e.g. MVC) and the ability to learn new technologies
· Code - Experience in developing with Ruby on Rails

About Tata Consultancy Services:
Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 50 years. TCS offers a consulting-led, cognitive powered, integrated portfolio of business, technology and engineering services and solutions. This is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development.
A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 528,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 46 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $22.2 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2021, and is listed on the BSE (formerly Bombay Stock Exchange) and the NSE (National Stock Exchange) in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index. For more information, visit www.tcs.com
About TCS UK&I:
There are 19000+ employees across 60 locations in UK & Ireland representing 54 nationalities.
TCS ranked No.1 for customer satisfaction in the UK & Europe. We have 200+ customers including 40 from the FTSE 100.
TCS UK was recognised for its employee-friendly workplace practices and continued investments in building up local talent in the UK through professional development initiatives and digital skills programs. TCS’ UK workforce is a young and diverse one, with 54 nationalities represented. Women make up 28% of the workforce, much higher than the 17% average in the UK IT sector.
For more information, visit us at www.tcs.com.

Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Job description: § Collaborate across Agile teams with Architects, Developers, Quality, Data, Security, and other Operations engineers on designing and implementing highly…
full-description:
Site Reliability Team Manager
About the position:
About the role:
Anvil, an Everbridge company, is looking for a skilled member of its SaaS Operations team with functional knowledge in all areas of technology operations and site reliability with particularly emphasis automation in a windows environment. The ideal candidate will fulfill the critical role of ensuring our systems are healthy, monitored, and designed to scale. The successful candidate should have hands-on experience in a web-scale role with emphasis on software-as-a-service. Candidates should also have experience designing, planning, implementing, tuning and operating technology including application servers, virtual machine & container management, migrating workloads to the public cloud, large-scale monitoring/trending techniques, micro-service architectures, clustering technology, configuration management and creative scaling techniques.
About the team:
As a member of our Operations team, you will join a team of dedicated, intelligent, fast-paced engineers. You’ll work in a hybrid cloud environment that will power our company’s impressive growth. You will bring a data driven approach to automation, security, scalability, & monitoring/alerting at Anvil.
What you'll do:
§ Own operational availability, security, scalability, efficiency, monitoring, instrumentation, and overall service reliability of Everbridge's solutions.
§ Collaborate across Agile teams with Architects, Developers, Quality, Data, Security, and other Operations engineers on designing and implementing highly reliable solutions.
§ Embrace engineering principles of proactivity, automation, cross-functional collaboration, curiosity, and data-driven decision making.
§ Enhance our infrastructure, tooling, and processes to extend operability as a self-service function for other groups within engineering.
§ Participate in a rotating on-call schedule to troubleshoot and resolve production escalations.
§ Have fun while we work hard to make a difference.
What you'll bring:
§ Bachelor's degree or equivalent
§ Large scale production Windows operating system, application, and security maintenance in an online web facing environment
§ Orchestration framework, configuration management, and software-defined infrastructure management techniques (i.e. SaltStack, Terraform, Kubernetes, Cloud Formation, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, etc.)
§ Automation experience with PowerShell
§ Application virtualization, containerization, and service-oriented-architecture technologies
§ Experience supporting & automating systems in a cloud infrastructure – AWS
§ Experience with data systems and distributed systems including Microsoft SQL Server
§ Network architecture and operations with an emphasis on: application load balancing at local and global scale (ELB/ALB/NLB/Route 53), IPv4 routing and dynamic routing protocols (OSPF, BGP), IPsec VPN, CDN, DDOS Protection, WAF, and network security best practices
§ Hands-on experience with infrastructure as code tools and concepts (e.g. Terraform/Kubernetes/OpenShift/OpenStack/SaltCloud)
§ Skill in at least one programming/scripting language. (e.g. PowerShell, Linux Shell .Net/C#, Python, Perl, Ruby, Java, Javascript)
§ Experience in supporting legacy datacenter equipment and migrating it to the public cloud using modern IaaS and PaaS best practices

full-description:
Overview
We are currently searching for a passionate and talented Software Engineer for continuously integrating ML models and refinements into our product. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with the latest Microsoft technology in highly agile and collaborative engineering and data science teams.
While working at FISCAL, you will be able to develop and enhance your technical skills by utilising the latest technologies and techniques. We will also provide you with the opportunity to broaden your skillset in data science and engineering as this role sits at the interface between both. Our modern, supportive and collaborative working environment provides you with the opportunity to share knowledge and learn new skills, supporting your career and personal growth.
What you’ll be doing…
· Integrating new pipelines and features from research carried out in the data science team into the product based on Microsoft technology stack
· Optimising ML frameworks libraries
· Running datasets and interpreting results to ensure ML models are delivering results to the quality expected
· Actively contributing to sprint planning meetings, stand-ups and end of sprint retrospectives
· Supporting your colleagues and working to achieve common team goals
· Building software based on the Agile principles and practices including Scrum, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
We are looking for someone with…
· 2-3 years demonstrable experience of working with the following technologies: mainly C#, SQL and python (Azure would be advantageous)
· Great communication skills, who enjoys collaborating with a team of talented data scientists and engineers
· Knowledge of developing and expanding unit tests and/or automated test frameworks
· A conscientious and dedicated attitude, who is keen to learn new skills
· Strong problem-solving skills, who can think creatively
What gives you an edge…
· Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and big data tools (Spark, Hadoop)
· Skills in designing AI and Machine Learning systems to automate predictive models
· Previous experience of developing and enhancing SaaS products
· Experience of working in a dynamic Agile software development team
Need any more reasons to work with us?
It’s an exciting time to join FISCAL Technologies as we are expanding which will give you an opportunity to stand out and grow with us.
Established in 2003 and operating in the ‘Fintech’ space, FISCAL has approximately 50 employees, it is an environment where you will have an opportunity to make a big difference, we work hard but have a good time too!
We give back by supporting our chosen charity of the year and hold lots of fun events for employees to take part in. The company has been an award recipient multiple times for being a great place to work and we’re proud to hold a Queen’s award for innovation.
· 20 days Annual Leave plus 8 Bank Holidays, increasing by 1 day per year up to a maximum of 25 days
· Holiday buy & sell scheme
· £500 per annum Wellbeing Allowance, including Perkbox
· Employer pension contribution and life assurance
· Free hot/cold drinks, fruit and snacks
· An inclusive employee recognition scheme with monthly gift voucher prizes
· Free on-site parking
· Cycle to work scheme

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job description: 2+ years practical experience preferred but not vital - you'll be the first engineer in Ezoic UK so experience is a plus; however, you'll have regular contact…
full-description:
About Ezoic:

We're a fast-growing tech platform providing machine-learning data-driven solutions for website owners. With 5 offices worldwide and a HQ in Southern California we're VC-backed and profitable. Ezoic has a flat management structure and gives team members complete autonomy over their work. We believe in productivity, not presenteeism, move fast and get stuff done! We're looking for someone with energy, initiative and drive who will hit the ground running and make a difference from the get-go!
Benefits:
Flexible working environment, part-time work from home option and untracked time off (unlimited holiday)
Latest-gen PC or Macbook, sit-stand desks and quad-monitors in modern airy offices close to the buzz of the Newcastle quayside
£30-48K salary (negotiable depending on experience) with ongoing reviews, share options, regular team lunches and events - ask me about Perky!
Dog- and family-friendly offices, pool table, ping pong, video games, massage chairs, bean-to-cup coffee and much more...
Role:
Supporting a specific permanent project building web-pages and tools for tech-savvy publishers from scratch to support a niche sales process. You'll be a key part of a tight-knit team that makes the decisions and owns the development of the project. As the first engineer in Newcastle a pioneering spirit will be needed! Specifically, you'll:
build out webpages and tools to control and customize tech publishers' sites.
help solve technical challenges surrounding publishers' bespoke setups to ensure our tech works seamlessly with their sites and visitors
communicate with tech publishers over slack to understand their needs and collaborate to build tools to improve their site's performance
Requirements:
2+ years practical experience preferred but not vital - you'll be the first engineer in Ezoic UK so experience is a plus; however, you'll have regular contact/mentoring with the large engineering team in US so you'll get great support.
A Bachelor's Degree, or engineering bootcamp graduate is preferred
Strong client-side HTML/CSS/JavaScript/AJAX skills and experience and a familiarity with cross-browser debugging
Experience with Node/PHP/Go to retrieve and process data
Responsibilities:

Working closely with Sales team, other engineering teams and publishers, to turn ideas into working applications.
Creating wireframes and designs that result a great user experience
Implementing technical challenges with bespoke site setups to ensure seamless integration with Ezoic solutions
Bottom Line
Our CEO is an engineer and the company is data-driven, doesn't do politics, and gives freedom to team members to work in the way that suits them best and makes them most productive. We communicate openly and honestly across the company and have an open-data policy. Everyone in the company is a vital part of the whole and is treated like the intelligent adult they are. Oh, and we like to have fun too!
#ZR

full-description:
LOCATION: Edinburgh / UK / Europe preferred (Work from home, in a GMT compatible timezone)
DURATION: Permanent.
HOURS: Full-time.
asensei is looking for a software engineer to join asensei.ai, a new developer platform revolutionizing Connected Fitness with the easiest way to add technique coaching and correction to digital sport and fitness products.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rv3sLvq3nUQ
We believe that every digital fitness experience should be powered by Connected Coaching.
We live in a future where you pull on your favorite brand of sports apparel powered by "asensei inside" to add motion capture and understanding.
We live in a future where the voice of your favorite athletes or coaches are in your ear, guiding and correcting your practice in real-time.
We believe that consumers will demand their sports apparel and fitness products have "asensei inside" and your role is to help us get to that future faster.
RESPONSIBLITIES:
As an early-stage venture-backed company, you'll work directly with the CTO and engineering team to develop new features and capabilities for asensei.ai.
asensei.ai is a developer platform and SDK that allows 3rd party Connected Fitness products and digital fitness apps to add our Connected Coaching capabilities to their products. You will work within a product team that spans hardware, firmware, software and consumer-facing UX. You will play a key role in developing our SDKs, our blueprints (pre-built experiences for common sports coaching experiences) and sample applications that illustrate to developers how to incorporate our SDKs into their own apps and products.
This role is for a full-stack developer, with an emphasis on front-end development of UX components and underlying libraries, and demo/sample apps that make it easy for others to understand how to work with our SDKs.
REQUIREMENTS:
Passion for building software that will scale to a growing user base.
Around 3 or more years of experience in the following areas:
delivering mobile or desktop apps using Ionic and Angular.
working with web technologies including TypeScript, HTML and CSS.
delivering cross-platform apps with Capacitor
working in an environment with tools including NPM, Git and GitHub
Strong understanding of software engineering principles and fundamentals.
Great team player - able to communicate clearly, written and verbal, and a desire to help others and identify and solve problems across the business.
Curiosity - to learn new skills and methods and to understand the problems that customers are facing.
BONUS POINTS FOR:
Test Driven Development: Experience developing software in a Test-driven Development environment, in a continuous integration environment such as Travis CI.
Modern Cloud Development: AWS, Pulumi
Backend: Experience with Firebase, MongoDB
Frontend: working in a Visual Studio Code environment
Web Application Frameworks: Node.js and Express
Native API integration: React Native, creating Capacitor plugins.
Are an athlete or coach, or someone who is otherwise passionate about sport and coaching.
ABOUT ASENSEI:
Founded in 2014, asensei is democratizing access to world class instruction by offering the easiest way to add technique coaching to any sport, fitness or physical therapy product. For apparel and equipment providers, connected fitness or brick and mortar facilities, asensei strengthens engagement, locks in loyalty and improves retention by turning solo practice into instructional learning, weaving connected coaching into clothing and showing customers measurable progress along their learning path. The asensei.ai technology platform offers everything a brand needs to bring Connected Coaching to their customers.
asensei: Practice. Perfected.
For more information visit www.asensei.com.'

full-description:
We are seeking an experienced developer to work on the C# .NET custom web applications and MSSQL database systems that we design and build; our clients are mainly public sector and our solutions are often high profile.
You will engage with each project from requirements analysis through all stages of the build and testing, and will create Database Schemas, Software Specifications and Test Plans. You will work both independently and as a Lead Developer within a project team, working across a diverse portfolio of projects, both for existing clients and new ones.
Unusually, we offer the opportunity to develop on both Linux and Windows stacks. The focus of this role is C#/.Net development in Umbraco, but we are very keen to talk to candidates who can in addition demonstrate experience with PHP 7+.
You will create clean, structured code that is well-documented and compliant with GDPR and accessibility guidelines, and web standards. As a senior member of our team, you will identify opportunities for efficiency and improvement, such as building core code libraries, as well as mentor junior developers and contribute to standards development.
We are looking for an excellent developer who wants to make a difference through continuous improvement of themselves and the wider team you work with.

A minimum of 5+ years’ similar experience in an agency or environment with multiple customers
Qualifications
Degree level qualification in a relevant subject
Essential Skills
· C#/.NET
· MSSQL
· JQuery
· rest APIs
· HTML
· CSS
You should also be fully conversant with web standards and WCAG 2.1 accessibility and have a good understanding of GDPR, creating secure web applications, the latest security threats and mitigation against them.

Desirable Skills
· PHP7+
· PostgreSQL
· Javascript
· Coding for open source CMS’ e.g Umbraco or WordPress
· Experience of MVC and unit testing
· Agile
Qualities
The ideal candidate will be an excellent, pragmatic problem-solver and an enthusiastic and supportive team player, willing to get stuck in and provide excellent support to the team members around you.
We’d love to see good interpersonal skills with the ability to explain technical matters to non-technical clients and staff. You should be able to work on multiple projects at once and work well under pressure.
You should take pride in your professional working practices, expecting high standards of yourself and others around you.
We really want to talk to candidates who are passionate about keeping up to date with the latest software development methodologies and technologies and have a real enthusiasm for web technology.
About us
Connect is a specialist provider of award-winning web solutions. We are experts in web development and design, intranet development, app development, content management systems, database systems and software development. Our clients include the DVLA, HMRC, HM Treasury, NHS Education for Scotland, the Welsh Government, North West Air Ambulance, Cardiff University and Hewlett Packard. We operate a hybrid working model, partly in our city centre office and with the option to work from home for part of the week.

Bike.Rent Manager is the world's leading bike rental platform.
Job description
Background:
Bike.Rent Manager is the industry leading bike rental platform. We have spent over 10 years developing and rolling out our B2B platform for bike rental operations around the world. For the next phase of our exciting journey, we are launching our B2C platform called Bike.Rent.
Job Role:
As a lead developer, you would be responsible for directing the development team in the design, development, coding, testing and debugging of applications. You would also coordinate the development staff’s schedule and ensure effective communication between team members and other key stakeholders. Additionally, you will be expected to provide feedback and suggestions for process and product improvement and act as a technical mentor and adviser.
You would have a dotted line into the head of product and another into our CTO for architectural guidance.
As well as being technically able, you'll be an effective leader, capable of creating clear actionable strategies to improve our software engineering efforts, great at bringing engineers together to remove impediments that get in our way, and you'll be an approachable and inclusive leader who thrives on seeing the people under your care achieve.
