Title: PHP Developer
Job description: MyWorkwear is looking for a Web Developer with experience working full-stack (PHP, JavaScript, jQuery etc) who, working closely with an experienced IT Leader…
full-description:
About the role
MyWorkwear is looking for a Web Developer with experience working full-stack (PHP, JavaScript, jQuery etc) who, working closely with an experienced IT Leader and other developers, will help shape our in-house systems and our high traffic e-commerce website.
We are an ambitious, fast-growing business and technology is at the centre of our strategy to continue our growth.
This role would suit a Developer who thrives in an autonomous working environment and who relishes the challenge of converting business requirements into technical solutions with the drive to work independently to achieve results.
You will report to one of the company directors who has a background as a web developer; together you will build performant, usable systems and sometimes push technical boundaries to find new and exciting ways to stay ahead of the game, creating efficiency savings or driving more sales for the business.
Based in Telford we offer a modern workspace but are also happy to offer long term remote working or a hybrid of both remote and in-office if preferred, you will be required to attend the office for occasional meetings and events.
You will ideally be based in the West Midlands and you should have most of the following key skills:
Strong OO PHP experience
Database design (MySQL etc)
Git version control experience
Demonstrable ability to convert business ideas into technical solutions
Web Services exposure
Front end understanding – HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
The ability to work independently to produce high quality, maintainable, well-documented code
In return, you can expect a starting salary of £28,000 - £35,000 dependent on experience, with long term remote working available if required and a real commitment to personal development within a high growth, market-leading company.
About Us
MyWorkwear is one of the UK’s leading suppliers of embroidered and printed clothing. Based in Telford, Shropshire, we have modernised a long-established business with significant investment into our in-house systems and website to create a competitive advantage that has led to significant growth over the last few years.
Our skilled team produce thousands of garments per week, supplying companies, large and small, from across the UK. As a tech-driven business, we combine our in-house technology with industry-leading embroidery and heat transfer machines to brand uniforms for clients as diverse as Vimto, Oxford University and the NHS.
As a small friendly team, we aim to provide the highest level of customer service, quality products and great value every day, by putting our customers' needs at the heart of everything we do.
At MyWorkwear we provide a fantastic working environment for all our staff. We strive to be a friendly and inclusive workplace and have a diverse team of people who share a passion for providing excellent service and quality workwear.
Our aim is for MyWorkwear to be a place where people want to come to work and given some team members have been with us for over 30 years, we think it may well be true.

full-description:
Product Developer – Apparel
Jöttnar produces technical outdoor clothing for mountain sports. We are a young, fast-growing company, making the finest technical outwear at the higher end of the performance and quality market. We are now strengthening our apparel product development team.
As an e-commerce only company, we have intimate end-user knowledge and no third-party retailer price pressures. We produce product to our own and our customers’ demanding specifications.
Ambitious, high-energy and creative product developers will have a ball here, developing those highest specification products you’ve dreamed about.
Key Duties
Working to and with the direct support of the Product Development Manager (PDM), you will:
Research design concepts and trends, fabrics and trims, construction processes and manufacturing solutions.
Identify new product opportunities.
Produce detailed technical packs including fully annotated spec drawings, fit direction, and material information.
Ensure visibility of supplier costs and MOQs.
Ensure full and on-time realisation of your assigned prototype development in-line with the Critical Path.
Contribute to product development standards and ensure consistency across the range plan.
Manage trim sourcing, development, and commercialisation in collaboration with PDM and suppliers.
Collaborate with in-house QC and external manufacturing partners to resolve fit, style and construction issues and ensure a fully commercialised performance product.
Collaborate with in-house QC to test materials and trims.
Support the creation of field and wear test samples and running of trials with the Jöttnar Pro Team.
Requirements.
Relevant degree in apparel design, fashion materials and technology or equivalent experience with sportswear, performance and outdoor apparel.
Knowledge of performance fabrics, rainwear and insulation.
Knowledge of fit, patterns and measurements, including previous pattern making experience.
Experience of working with overseas suppliers.
Excellent attention to detail, including accurate data entry skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and Adobe Illustrator.
Strong knowledge of Jöttnar’s products.
An interest or involvement in outdoor and mountain sports and activities.
Benefits
Salary £30,000 - £32,000 DOE.
Pension.
Employee discount.
25 working days paid holiday per year, in addition to normal bank and public holidays.
Office-based or WFH by agreement, Cardiff, Monday to Friday. Friday is a non-working day beyond probationary period.
Application process
Please send a two-page CV and cover letter with “Product Developer – Apparel ” followed by your name in the subject line.
Your CV must be no longer than two pages and your covering letter no longer than one page.
Applications to be received by 8th Jan 2021. Sooner is preferred. Interviews dates will follow.
Job starts in line with your notice, but preferably as soon as possible.

full-description:
TLDR
Web Developer – Ruby on Rails
We are a marketplace startup, looking for a mid/senior Ruby on Rails web developer based in the UK to join our team. We offer autonomy, flexibility and support to grow within your role with a competitive salary and options package.
Who we are
Materials Market is the UK’s first and only marketplace for building materials. As an early-stage startup that launched in November 2020, we have grown at an astonishing rate and have achieved serious traction in a very short space of time. We are pioneering a new approach to the sale of building materials; using cutting-edge marketplace technology to connect buyers and sellers in a transparent and competitive online space.
Overview
We’re looking for a mid/senior Ruby on Rails developer who is eager to work within a new team of developers. This is a great opportunity and a role with significant autonomy and responsibility. The role will suit someone who is more backend focused but wanting to take the next step in their career to become “full stack”.
Initial responsibilities will include assisting our current agency dev team as we transition to a complete in-house dev team. As only the third hire within the development team, you will be an integral member of our ecosystem and will help us develop our company culture.
We operate a flexible work environment. Our offices are in central London and team meetings, brainstorming sessions and other collaborative projects will require attendance in person one or two times a month. All development time can be home based.
We want to work with people who are passionate, curious and honest, so if that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Front End WordPress Developer
Job description:
Utilising a variety of markup languages to develop pixel perfect, responsive web pages.
Ensuring web development is optimized for smartphones.
full-description:
SoBold is a high-performance, WordPress website design and development agency based in London. We have gone from strength to strength since our inception in 2014 and now is the time to super-charge this.
We are looking for an ambitious Junior Front End WordPress Developer to join our growing team. We work with companies of all sizes from small boutique brands, to publicly listed businesses and household names.
In this role, you will work closely with other Back End and Front End WordPress Developers and will report directly to the Lead Developer. You must be confident and willing to bring innovative ideas to the table.
Key Responsibilities
Utilising a variety of markup languages to develop pixel perfect, responsive web pages.
Ensuring web development is optimized for smartphones.
Building reusable code for future use.
Optimizing web pages for maximum speed and scalability.
Create documentation outlining processes and/or offering advice on how to go about tackling certain issues for clients and other team members.
Snagging and testing websites to ensure they adhere to our high standards.
--
Key Requirements
Exceptional understanding of HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
Good understanding of PHP to render WordPress websites.
Experience with custom post types, Gutenberg and the Advanced Custom Fields plugin.
Very good knowledge of GIT based workflows.
Experience with responsive and adaptive design.
High level of understanding of SEO principles.
Good planning and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills.
--
Benefits
Annual discretionary bonus
Private Healthcare
25 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)
A hybrid working environment, with up to two days working from home per week after your first three months.
--
Our hiring process
You can apply for this role on Indeed, LinkedIn or directly on our website, you'll hear back from us either way.
Here's a brief overview of what you can expect from the rest of our hiring process:
1) We review your application and portfolio.
2) A 30-minute phone call with our Lead Developer so we can find out more about you and you can find out more about the business and role.
3) A small WordPress related task.
4) A follow-up interview with our Lead Developer and Managing Director to discuss how you found the task.
5) A face-to-face meeting to give you a flavour of our team and offices and so we can give you an introduction to some of our workflows and processes.
6) Get an offer!

About Tata Consultancy Services:
Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 50 years. TCS offers a consulting-led, cognitive powered, integrated portfolio of business, technology and engineering services and solutions. This is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development.
A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 528,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 46 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $22.2 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2021, and is listed on the BSE (formerly Bombay Stock Exchange) and the NSE (National Stock Exchange) in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index. For more information, visit www.tcs.com
About TCS UK&I:
There are 19000+ employees across 60 locations in UK & Ireland representing 54 nationalities.
TCS ranked No.1 for customer satisfaction in the UK & Europe. We have 200+ customers including 40 from the FTSE 100.
TCS UK was recognised for its employee-friendly workplace practices and continued investments in building up local talent in the UK through professional development initiatives and digital skills programs. TCS’ UK workforce is a young and diverse one, with 54 nationalities represented. Women make up 28% of the workforce, much higher than the 17% average in the UK IT sector.
For more information, visit us at www.tcs.com.
Diversity and Inclusion:
At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’.
We encourage applications from all sections of society. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion, or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sex, pregnancy and maternity, citizenship, marital, domestic, or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
TCS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to its employees and applicants for employment to ensure that individuals with disabilities enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities. If you are an applicant who needs an accommodation due to a disability to complete an employment application or during any phase of the hiring process, please contact us with the subject line: "Disability Accommodation Request".
Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually regarding the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days then the application should be deemed unsuccessful.

There are no midnight coding sessions here.

full-description:
We're looking out for a brilliant Node.JS Developer to join our mission to save the world with technology. This is a super exciting opportunity to start in a breakthrough role at 3 Sided Cube, as we expand our tech stacks. If you're at your happiest configuring servers and writing awesome APIs, we'd love to hear from you!
*Please note, our offices will be closed between 23rd December - 3rd January, so we will respond to applicants when we re-open on 4th January 2022*
Make a difference with code
Do you want to be part of a growing team who are passionate, curious, and brilliant?
Server-side roles here at at Cube are something special. You get to work at scale, experience big data and looks after multiple apps, life-saving data feeds and APIs that help people all across the globe.
There are no midnight coding sessions here. Our team of back end developers know their stuff and are proud of the impact our technology has on millions of lives. Want to be a part of it? Keep reading…
Salary: £40,000-£45,000 (depending on experience)
Location: Bournemouth or Remote options
The stuff you need:
A strong understanding of Node.JS and OOP
Experience using web frameworks such as Express, Nest, or Adonis
Knowledge of relational databases and search systems e.g. MySQL, ElasticSearch
Experience developing and maintaining RESTful APIs
A strong understanding of web application security
Knowledge of version control systems. We use Git.
An understanding of approaches to scaling high traffic web applications
Experience configuring, maintaining and securing Linux servers
What makes you special?
Experience using containerised applications and tools such as Docker and Docker Compose
Knowledge of server orchestration tools such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible
Experience writing and maintaining testable code and test-driven development
Experience using CI & CD in a team environment
Experience working in a DevOps/cloud hosting environment e.g. AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.
Experience in a digital agency environment
Familiar with tools such as JIRA and Bitbucket.
3 reasons to join our team
1. Time to work on innovation projects
Innovation Time at Cube means that you get a whole week every 3 months to work on a new idea, a project you’re passionate about or to try out new tech.
INNOVATION HUB
2. Personal development plans
Every member of our team has a personal plan of where you want to go and what you need to get there. We give you everything you need to reach your full potential.
3. Agency culture and life at 3 Sided Cube
Work in a relaxed office environment – or fully remote; we buy Friday lunches and organise regular activities for the whole team. Plus we encourage attending conferences, events and collaborative working.
LIFE AT CUBE
Let's talk about the day job.
Work with big data that saves lives
Support the Frontend and Mobile teams to build and maintain applications used by millions
Investigate and debug application issues at scale
Experiment with serverless and voice technology
Collaborate and communicate effectively across the organisation
Proactively learn and grow as a developer.
A bit about us...
3 Sided Cube is a multi-award winning app development and digital agency based in the UK, with a particular passion for building technology for good.
Be it life-saving, life-changing or problem-solving, we champion the genius over the generic. And due to an exciting period of growth, we are looking for new talent to join our team.
A few more reasons to join team Cube:
You get to work on some incredible projects with a talented team around you who are all focussed on our mission to change the world for the better using technology
Regular Innovation week – time to work on your own ideas
Strong focus on wellbeing and personal development. We care about you as well as your career!
Additional holiday day for each year of service.
Fully subsidised counselling services
3 days a year (paid) to volunteer for a registered charity
We donate to a charity of your choice on your birthday.
Flexible hours, remote working and a relaxed office environment – comfy sofas, pool table, a great sound system, giant beanbags…
Free parking and a Bike to Work Scheme
Free Lunch Friday, free breakfast, fruit, green tea, gin… the list goes on
Regular team socials, fundraising and volunteering opportunities and an annual team weekend away.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job description: As a heavy automator of other software including the SOLIDWORKS CAD software and Microsoft Office, a significant part of the original code base is written in…
full-description:
Us
DriveWorks is a UK headquartered, award-winning software company with global sales through our resellers. Our company is built on innovative technology, high standards, market insight, sharing knowledge and a vibrant mix of talent.
Our Design Automation & Product Configurator software enables businesses around the world to design, personalize, and sell custom products in a highly visual and engaging way, including live, online 3D visualization.
Companies are embracing digital technologies and our software is key to helping manufacturers move forward. With increased demand from the industry, and funding from BGF, we’re growing rapidly, investing in our people and resources – it’s a great time to join us!
We are a forward-thinking, growing business. Our people are at the heart of everything we do and our offices are inspiring places to be. We’re committed to supporting our teams with the training, tools, and knowledge they need to build incredible solutions, driven by innovation and customer feedback.
We
Are a small team of highly-talented .NET developers creating software our users around the world *love* to use, to realize huge gains inside of our customers’ businesses.
Get excited by delivering new features and improvements that put new capabilities in the hands of our users and reduce friction in their daily lives.
Are perpetually curious about software development and how we can improve what we do.
Are big believers in an agile approach to software development.
Are looking to expand our team to tackle even bigger challenges as we grow the company.
Work in beautiful surroundings in converted barns with modern facilities in Thelwall, Warrington.
Can’t wait to meet you!
You
Are an experienced and highly engaged developer who cares deeply about delivering robust software that excites and delights users.
Stay abreast of the latest technologies and developments and think about how it can be applied to improve the lives of both our teams and our customers.
Enjoy working with other developers whether mentoring those who are just embarking on their development career and need guidance and mentorship, or working with peers to drive the product forward.
Enjoy the prospect of working with the wider team to help guide product direction and support our users, in particular our colleagues in Sales and Support.
Can see some of our software in action at https://driveworkslive.com/
Our Stack
We were an early adopter of the .NET platform, kicking the tyres since the very first beta some 20 years ago! and we use it, and web technologies to great effect. We deliver a suite of Desktop, Server, Web, and Hybrid Cloud software; all with an API that our customers, resellers, and partners can use to extend the software to encompass situations beyond what we had envisioned!
We are always looking at new technology and trying to stay ahead of the curve. Our principal technology stack is based on .NET Framework 4.8, but with the recent release of .NET 6 we are very excited to transition and unlock a new wave of capability for the future.
We have a mix of languages in place. As a heavy automator of other software including the SOLIDWORKS CAD software and Microsoft Office, a significant part of the original code base is written in Visual Basic .NET which has served us very well over the years. However, over time, and especially since C# has caught up at interoperation, we also have significant C# usage, and C# is our focus for the future of our back-end stack.
On the front-end, our language of choice is TypeScript; we are huge fans of type safety as an aide to building robust, scalable software, with the ability to fearlessly refactor.
Location
Whilst we are in the main an office-based team, there is opportunity to work from home as a hybrid role. We work in modern offices in converted barns in Thelwall, Warrington with easy access to the M56, M62 and the M6, and plenty of free on-site parking.
Our offices are a warm and welcoming environment with the latest technology and equipment, a pool table, a beer fridge, secret chocolate treats and a great team of enthusiastic people.
Sounds Interesting?
Please send your CV and a covering email explaining why you would like to work for us. Please note you must already have a right to work in the UK.

Title: Principal Software Engineer
Job description: You will be the technical lead for our software engineers and motivate, direct and coach with the aim of running a high performing team.
full-description:
Position: Principal Software Engineer
Location: Leeds & Flex
Salary: £80,000 - £110,000

GDS Group is a global event, research and technology services company dedicated to helping clients meet the challenges posed by a fast-moving, digital, transformative business environment. Our outstanding B2B Digital Summits, Round Tables and Virtual Showcase events bring purchaser and provider communities together to find solutions to real-world business challenges.

By researching, creating, and delivering insight-led content, every event strengthens our reputation and demonstrates our position of expertise in the industries and verticals in which we operate.

A bit about us:

We currently work with the C-Suite in some of the world’s most well-known brands such as IBM, Oracle, Microsoft, Nike, Gucci, Amazon and many more
We have office locations and broadcast studios in Bristol, Miami and New York, with more expansion plans afoot!
We’re on target to grow by 70% in 2021 and grew parts of our business by over 200% in 2020
We have a world class training and development team ready to help you improve your skills and achieve your goals
Whether you want to work with the latest tech or just be part of a talented, ambitious and fun team, we believe we have a fantastic opportunity to help you take the next step in your career.

Why work with us?

Work with leading edge technology, game tech, AWS and have the freedom to explore and innovate.
Develop and create an immersive and rich customer experience using a mix of web, mobile and game technology.
Build our always on, scalable back end services and platform. The engine which powers our platform!
Join a brand new well funded start up backed by a pandemic proof group business.
A rich 25 year heritage in digital events and immersive experiences.
Over 1,000 events per year and work with global house hold names!
Awesome culture with a focus on our people and learning.
Flex working – collaborate, explore, innovate!
Create a cutting-edge ‘never been done’ before greenfield platform.
Cross functional teams and agile to the core.
Accelerate your potential and work with the best and brightest!

About the role:

GDS Group is seeking a passionate and innovative Principal Software Engineer to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to work and lead on a greenfield ‘never been done before’ product leveraging the latest technology.

We are looking for a Rockstar! A Principal Software Engineer who loves to explore and innovate with the aim of creating a truly first class enterprise virtual platform and product. If you have any backend virtual world or gaming experience then this is the place for you!

You will design and build the powerhouse that sits behind the next generation of virtual and immersive web experiences which will be a key component of our SaaS product offering. You will create a low latent high performing connected platform, integrate with real-time data feeds and leverage content management and configuration tools to provide the business with applications to effectively manage multiple experiences. This is a critical role, working in a creative environment with an awesome culture allowing you to build brilliant software using the latest and best in class technologies. You will:

Turn concepts and requirements into highly available applications and systems using industry standard languages and technologies such as Java, Spring Boot and Kafka.
You will be the technical lead for our software engineers and motivate, direct and coach with the aim of running a high performing team.
You will work closely with our Agile Delivery Leads to ensure we meet our objectives and produce high quality software deliverables.
You will evangelise & prioritise engineering best practice in your squad(s) so there is a clear direction for continuous improvement.
You will collaborate with other engineers and lead architect to develop highly scalable distributed systems that can handle high volumes of data in a high load environment.
You will actively participate in application design, database design, data-flows, and detailed technical design.
You will participate in open discussions about architecting solutions to satisfy the business and technical requirements.

Our client based in Cambridge are looking for a C++ Developer to join their core media processing development team in Cambridge . At the current time this is work from home and post Covid envisage the reality being 3 days at home and a couple of days in the office .
They are an established developer and manufacturer of specialised automation, media processing and graphics software systems for broadcast television with offices abroad as well as in Cambridge . They have a strong reputation for quality, innovation and technical excellence. They are a German owned company that employs over 11,500 across Europe and beyond .
Their customers include all the main top broadcasters throughout the world inc Sky , BBC ,ITV Disney etc and are an engineering driven company working together as a friendly team with a passion for developing state of the art software in an agile software development environment.
C++ Developer - salary dependant on level of experience
The Role
As a member of their C++ team you will be working on the development of their cross platform Windows and Linux StreamMaster product which is based on their MediaPipeline processing engine .
This role offers a huge variety of technical challenges and requires a willingness to work on many diverse aspects of the software with a pragmatic approach to delivering high quality reliable code at all stages of the product life cycle in an Agile environment.

A degree in Computer Science or a compatible engineering discipline.
Experience using C++ and multi-threading
Windows and Linux
Sound knowledge of software engineering principles.
Ability to work within a dynamic and rapid code development culture without sacrificing quality.
Excellent communication skills, oral and written, with a willingness to present creative technical solutions to the team.
A passion for technology and problem solving.
Willingness to learn from and communicate with the rest of the team.
Ability to be a team player or work alone as appropriate for the task at hand.
Agile development environment and experience of JIRA/GIT , cross platform development for Windows and Linux and/or graphics experience would be an advantage.
An interest in video/audio/media/graphics processing, high speed networking and/or high performance computing would also be an advantage
In return they offer an excellent salary and benefits package together with the opportunity to work in a friendly engineering driven, intellectually stimulating and challenging environment which values technical creativity and customer focus .
If you have any interest in the TV and Broadcast industry , set top box , video graphics or computer animation you will be amongst like minded people there . They are also willing to invest in courses relevant to the TV and broadcast industry to help you gain insight into the business

Title: Software Engineer in Test
Job description: This is a critical role, working in a creative environment with an awesome culture allowing you to be part of a team who build brilliant software using the…
full-description:
Position: Software Engineer in Test
Location: Leeds & Flex
Salary: £50,000 - £60,000

GDS Group is a global event, research and technology services company dedicated to helping clients meet the challenges posed by a fast-moving, digital, transformative business environment. Our outstanding B2B Digital Summits, Round Tables and Virtual Showcase events bring purchaser and provider communities together to find solutions to real-world business challenges.

By researching, creating, and delivering insight-led content, every event strengthens our reputation and demonstrates our position of expertise in the industries and verticals in which we operate.

A bit about us:

We currently work with the C-Suite in some of the world’s most well-known brands such as IBM, Oracle, Microsoft, Nike, Gucci, Amazon and many more
We have office locations and broadcast studios in Bristol, Miami and New York, with more expansion plans afoot!
We’re on target to grow by 70% in 2021 and grew parts of our business by over 200% in 2020
We have a world class training and development team ready to help you improve your skills and achieve your goals
Whether you want to work with the latest tech or just be part of a talented, ambitious and fun team, we believe we have a fantastic opportunity to help you take the next step in your career.

Why work with us?

Work with leading edge technology, game tech, AWS and have the freedom to explore and innovate.
Develop and create an immersive and rich customer experience using a mix of web, mobile and game technology.
Build our always on, scalable back end services and platform. The engine which powers our platform!
Join a brand new well funded start up backed by a pandemic proof group business.
A rich 25 year heritage in digital events and immersive experiences.
Over 1,000 events per year and work with global house hold names!
Awesome culture with a focus on our people and learning.
Flex working – collaborate, explore, innovate!
Create a cutting-edge ‘never been done’ before greenfield platform.
Cross functional teams and agile to the core.
Accelerate your potential and work with the best and brightest!

About the role:

GDS Group is seeking a passionate and innovative Software Engineer in Test to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to work and lead on a greenfield ‘never been done before’ product leveraging the latest technology.

We are looking for individuals who love to explore and innovate with the aim of creating a truly first class enterprise virtual platform and product. If you have any backend virtual world or gaming experience then this is the place for you!

You will be responsible for defining our test strategy, building out our test automation framework, our regression test packs and ensuring we are continuously shipping a high quality product that is accessible and playable via the web and mobile. Our platform leverages a microservices architecture so along with front end testing we have an extensive need for automating our APIs and to exercise our non-functional requirements.
This is a critical role, working in a creative environment with an awesome culture allowing you to be part of a team who build brilliant software using the latest and best in class technologies. You will:

Be a rock star Software Engineer in Test with more than 7 years of relevant professional experience in automation testing.
You will have an established background and experience in manual testing and processes.
Have a deep knowledge of quality assurance methodologies, tools, techniques, processes and the SDLC.
Have demonstrable hands-on experience with test design, implementation and execution of automation tests suites.
Be comfortable in advising and selecting best in class tooling and approaches.
You are familiar with test management systems and any bug tracking systems.
You will monitor quality standards and actively assist in the analysis of test results and act as an advocate for quality.
You will have deep experience in setting up and running automated acceptance tests enabling minimal regression testing and agile releases with almost zero defects.
You`ll be closely working in cross functional squads so working with development teams and product owners on daily basis.
Have in-depth knowledge and experience in developing test strategies and comprehensive test plans and test cases with a focus on accuracy and attention to detail.
You are self-motivated and proactive individual requiring minimal supervision, work comfortably in a cross-functional setting and in a constantly evolving environment.

Who are we looking for:

You are a senior expert with more than 7 years test experience of which the bulk of your experience should be in test automation of both front end websites and backend services and APIs.
You have a strong technical background and will have excellent working knowledge and understanding of a variety of tools e.g. SpecFlow, Gherkin, Selenium , Postman, Cucumber, Ready API, Jenkins, Browser Stack, Cypress, JMeter and Gatlin.
You be experienced in the testing of multiple environments and stages of release.
You will be an expert in automated and manual cross browser testing.
A strong problem solver and a self-starter with a ‘can do’ attitude.
Experienced in working in an agile environment (Scrum / Kanban). You’ll be someone who is happy to work independently or collaboratively on multiple tasks.
You are eager to work and solve problems in a team with minimal supervision.
Overall you are highly motivated SEiT who is passionate about quality, have strong communication skills and keen to continuously learn and share knowledge with others.

As the ideal candidate, you will have:

Minimum 7 years as a SEiT with extensive experience working with test tooling and developing automated testing suites.
A variety of experience and technical expertise of the available test frameworks and tools on the market.
Exposure to performance and aspects of security testing .
A good understanding of object-oriented programming and an appreciation of distributed systems design.
Some cloud exposure either AWS, Azure or GCP.

Desirable Experience

Knowledge of the virtual or gaming industry is a huge advantage.
Direct experience of testing games.

Title: Midweight PHP (Laravel) Developer. What's your point of Vue?
Job description:
Some bean bags and a table tennis table.
We have a great plan for zapping inefficiency and wastage in an old-school industry.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.
full-description:
Indiana Jones is looking for stuff then suddenly he’s running from a bloody great big boulder. Final-act stuff in most movies, but Raiders began with a bang and ramped it up from there.
Well, that’s what this job is like, except it won’t end with your face melting or propellers slicing your head off (hopefully).
We’re a small, friendly and collaborative bunch. It’s your typical small office business really. A few rows of desks and laptops. Some bean bags and a table tennis table. And some sweets on reception.
We have a great plan for zapping inefficiency and wastage in an old-school industry. It’s not glamorous. It’s not Biotech or Fintech. (We’ll think of a cool term right after we sort those sweets.) But it is leading-edge stuff in the business intelligence, analytics and market insight space. And if you have a strong sense of community so much the better.
We’re not looking for newbies. You’re a raw, hungry developer who wants to be trained and nurtured? Good luck – but sorry, see ya. We need a senior developer who can hit the ground running and deliver from day one.
You won’t find any prima donnas here. Our world is full of deadlines that must be met. Stop press is simply not an option. Stress levels inevitably rise as these deadlines approach so you’ll need to be comfortable working under pressure and adept at keeping those plates spinning.
Must-have exposure? Vue.js, PHP (Laravel). For you, software isn’t a job, it’s a craft. You’ve got a GitHub repository. You’re involved in meetups, forums etc. You own a hat and a whip (optional).
Culture is as important to us as it is to you. If you thrive in client-facing environments, enjoy interacting with both technical and non-technical audiences and love nothing more than taking an idea from mere concept to actual implementation then you’ll fit right in.
We’re evolving, pivoting quickly, chucking out stuff that doesn’t work. We’re surrounded by coffee shops so we’ll be brainstorming in those.
And the £££ isn’t your usual startup peanuts. We are looking at up to £65,000 plus benefits.
Interested to know more? get that CV and covering letter to us. No covering letter, no good. And don’t look at the Ark!
Reference ID: MGTX
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: Up to £65,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Our client makes it their business to understand the clients' key issues to provide end-to-end tailored solutions.
With extensive experience in communications systems, electronic sensors, and information assurance and in both the civil and military domains, they understand the technical complexities of modern and future systems. The team of over 350 engineering consultants develop new concepts, capabilities and systems to protect what matters most to their clients.
Our client remains a British centre of excellence for world-class innovation and engineering.
The Key Responsibilities of a DevOps Engineer:
· Deploying APIs and UI components into a Kubernetes cluster
· Integrating API / UI components with existing data stores and APIs
· Maintaining and developing existing architectural components including Data Ingest, Data Stores and REST APIs
Below is a list of Key Skills required for the DevOps Engineer role, however you will not be expected to have everything:
· Python
· Java
· Packaging and deployment technologies such as Puppet, Kubernetes and Docker
· Experience with Flask, Pulsar or Zookeeper would be an advantage
The client would also like to see some of the below, but this is not essential:
· Apache Nifi
· Flink
· Java
· Ansible
· Docker
· Kubernetes
· ELK stack
· Linux Sys Admin for deployed Clusters (10's of servers)
· Jenkins Pipeline development
· Integration / debugging
· Understanding complex system architectures
· Technologically curious / Willing / Able to tactically upskill new technologies
Our client is committed to a policy of Equal Opportunity, Diversity and Inclusion. Their working environment is friendly, innovative and inclusive. They can accommodate flexible working arrangements, and support a diverse work-force and those with additional needs.
Benefits/Perks:
· Flexi Leave and Flexi Time Scheme
· Annual Holiday
· Flexible Benefits
· Sickness Benefit
· Business Performance Related Bonus
· Share Save Plan
· Pension scheme

Title: Interim Java Developer - Hybrid Working x 8
Job description: Interim Java Developer - Hybrid Working x 8 - PSR 1JP00049864 Pay Rate: Up to £725 per day pay range subject to IR35 status Please note: min 2 days in the…
full-description:
What's involved with this role:
Interim Java Developer - Hybrid Working x 8 - PSR 1JP00049864 Pay Rate: Up to £725 per day pay range subject to IR35 status Please note: min 2 days in the London office. We are looking for an outstanding Java Developer, who can make a positive impact, and wants to contribute to the most demanding and exciting new digital service. We are looking for outstanding skills and you must be ready to quickly get to work within an Agile, multidisciplinary team of Developers, Designers, and Analysts focused on the CGBs’ flagship programme. We are looking for the kind of person who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy; what really excites the successful candidate is problem-solving and the opportunity to deliver innovative technology that carries real value for users. You will be expected to draw value from collaboration with others, actively seek input from colleagues and value a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy. Day-to-day you will be an integral part of that team in designing, creating and improving new and existing products, platforms and transactions across government. Skills/ experience:
Recent experience with Java 11 (or later).
Excellent understanding of TDD and BDD.
Experience with large microservice architectures.
Experience of working in an Agile environment.
Be willing to work in a pair programming environment.
Have experience in implementing APIs for internal and external use.
Have the skills to build up a useful, robust automated test suite to support a continuous deployment environment.
Be involved in the wider web development community, identifying good practices we can adopt and sharing our experiences.
Be knowledgeable of tools and techniques used within the wider team.
Take part in 2nd-line support of applications and platforms, including occasional support outside of office hours.
Have an ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Have working knowledge of Unix-like operating systems such as Linux and/or Mac OS X.
Have the ability to quickly research and learn new programming tools and techniques.
Understand of the use of Responsive Web Design.
It would also be desirable to have:
Working knowledge of Jackson, JAX-RS, mocking frameworks such as Mockito, and messaging platforms such as ActiveMQ or Kafka.
Experience of MongoDB or other document databases.
Experience of building and scaling high-traffic websites.
Experience of handling large data sets and scaling their handling and storage.
Person specification:
Flexible/adaptable. Adjusts quickly to changing priorities and conditions. Copes effectively with complexity and change.
Takes responsibility/ownership. Proactively removes blockers to ensure that work is delivered.
Is able to produce significant output with minimal wasted effort.
High standards.
Is committed to quality and is therefore willing to challenge colleagues and to constantly question their own approach.
Openness to criticism and ideas.
Draws value from collaboration with others.
Actively seeks input from colleagues and values a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy.
Strategic thinking and visioning. Able to understand and communicate the big picture and use it to prioritise and judge impact of smaller tasks and objectives.
Creativity/innovation.
Generates new and innovative approaches to problems. Isn’t bound by the status quo.
Enthusiasm.
Exhibits passion and excitement over work. Has a can-do attitude, even under pressure.
Considerate.
Enjoys working with and is sensitive to the needs of others.
Values a positive working environment

Title: Front End Developer
Job description:
You want variety and to regularly have new puzzles to solve.
To work efficiently and develop bespoke systems which save our clients time and money.
full-description:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ARE YOU READY FOR SOMETHING NEW?
You want space to innovate and influence
You want your work to make a real difference
You want the freedom to work when and where you want
You want variety and to regularly have new puzzles to solve
You want to be challenged and to keep learning
You don’t want to be a cog in a corporate machine
You want employers who care about your wellbeing
… then we want YOU!
We need you to play a critical role in the next phase of our growth as a company.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An opportunity has arisen to join the award-winning and dedicated Appt Team as a frontend developer. Appt is an ambitious and diverse tech agency with offices in South Yorkshire and South West China.
We have worked with 100s of clients across a variety of sectors to design and develop bespoke web and mobile based applications which solve real world problems. From systems which help to track and slow the onset of age-related health conditions, to AI bots who are learning to play Bridge, no two projects and no two days are ever the same at Appt.
As an agency we value efficiency, connectivity, and creativity. We aim:
To work efficiently and develop bespoke systems which save our clients time and money
To value people and create websites, apps and social media campaigns which bring people together
To be creative and use our technical know-how to bring our client’s creative ideas to life
As a frontend developer you will play an integral part in the small but skilled Appt Dev Team and work closely with the CTO to develop the client-side experience and framework for both new projects and our own internal platform.
--------
What You Will Do:
Engineer a client-side experience that’s both attractive and easy to use
Collaborate with backend developers to connect to live data sources
Analyse client requirements and develop a client-side experience to fulfil them
Craft clean, modular code underpinned by robust logic
Assess and develop solutions to protect against web security
Write unit tests to ensure consistent code quality
Optimise code for performance and usability
Bring ideas for new features / techniques / technologies
--------
What we’re looking for (essentials) :
3+ years’ experience as a front-end developer
Hands-on experience with ReactJS
Familiar with interacting with RESTful APIs
Experience with web technologies like HTML, CSS/SCSS/LESS, jQuery
Familiar with TDD and unit testing frameworks
A thorough understanding of the entire modern web development
Proficient with version tracking through Git
Understand the importance of writing efficient code which works on a range of devices
Understanding of accessibility standards and the value in building accessible frontend solutions
A bachelor level degree in Computer Science or equivalent real-world experience
Ability to travel to Sheffield for in-person meetings when required
--------
What we’re looking for (desirable) :
Hands-on experience with Docker and containers
Familiarity with TypeScript
A basic proficiency with backend languages and frameworks
Experience with app development using React Native
--------
What you can expect from us:
A competitive salary
Flexible working hours
Freedom to work remotely
16” MacBook Pro
New Mobile Phone + contract
Cash plan healthcare scheme
Furniture allowance to support WFH
Regular team socials
Opportunity to help shape the direction of a growing company

A growing company, ready to transform an already unique and industry-leading application. We offer a creative, agile and collaborative environment, where you can contribute to build real improvements and use your problem solving skills to be part of our disruptive plans to shape the industry.

full-description:
Our company details
ADSI are an established yet flourishing group whose core business is to provide end to end solutions across a range of technical products and services.
We have been in operation since 2002 and continue to grow our product portfolio to remain current in a world where technology is ever changing and developing.
Over the years of success, ADSI has built a team of technology experts and first-class in-house systems. To support our continued desire to lead the way within our industry and enhance our services, we have an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic Developer to join our business.
Role requirements
Our in-house bespoke systems are driven by Microsoft SQL databases with a number of Web and MS Access front-end tools.
The ideal candidate will have a rounded development background; we are looking for someone with the ability to develop applications in a prototype environment, someone with extensive experience in the design and creation of stored procedures and SQL functions along with the ability to write efficient code that avoids locking and is fully error trapped. Candidates must have experience of developing in a semi-live or live environment with current and demonstrable T-SQL knowledge.
In addition to Web based and VBA functional development, candidates will be required to conduct data extractions and produce data quality analysis and management information across a range of data sources.
The role will involve multiple ongoing inter-related system developments and enhancements; therefore, the candidate will need to demonstrate the ability to prioritise and manage development requests with a commercial and strategic approach. Being self-motivated, organised and methodical is also essential.
Technical Summary
Essential:
· Complex T-SQL (Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers) on Microsoft SQL Server
· Extensive VBA development experience in MS Access
· C# .NET / ASP.NET Application Development
· Experience of Web Services (Web API & WCF) Development
Desirable:
· MS SQL SSIS & SSRS
· MS Excel VBA Development Experience
· MS SQL Server Maintenance and Performance Experience
· Experience of working in an Agile environment
· Experience of business process automation software
· ETL/Data Warehouse experience
The successful applicant will be a core member involved in the ongoing development of our business.
Please note that this is an office-based role offering permanent employment. You will be based at our Head Office in Basildon.

Pocket Intelligence Limited is a high-tech company with the registered office located in Bristol. We aim to create more value-added services to support our partnership companies rapidly grow their business.

Overview:
We are looking for a software development apprentice to join our expanding team. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to learn and practice cutting edge IT technologies in Web and Mobile App development.
Main role / Responsibilities [will include but not be limited to]:
There are 2 major products we provide for local hospitality industry:
Pocket PoS and Pocket Order.
Pocket PoS: EPOS till System

It requires knowledge in HTML, CSS, JQuery, Cordova, Android, Java, ASP.NET and MS SQL database.
Pocket Order: Online Ordering services
You will learn how to develop web apps in Angular 2+ with Android and iOS.

Software testing or any work that utilises basic coding
Any other technical job that uses IT equipment or software
Any data analytics or reporting related role

If you hold international equivalents of the above qualifications, at the time of your application you must be able to provide an official document that states how your international qualifications compare to the UK qualifications.

Permanent IT developer and beyond

Title: Web Developer - Ruby on Rails
Job description:
We offer autonomy, flexibility and support to grow within your role with a competitive salary and options package.
We operate a flexible work environment.
full-description:
TLDR
Web Developer – Ruby on Rails
We are a marketplace startup, looking for a mid/senior Ruby on Rails web developer based in the UK to join our team. We offer autonomy, flexibility and support to grow within your role with a competitive salary and options package.
Who we are
Materials Market is the UK’s first and only marketplace for building materials. As an early-stage startup that launched in November 2020, we have grown at an astonishing rate and have achieved serious traction in a very short space of time. We are pioneering a new approach to the sale of building materials; using cutting-edge marketplace technology to connect buyers and sellers in a transparent and competitive online space.
Overview
We’re looking for a mid/senior Ruby on Rails developer who is eager to work within a new team of developers. This is a great opportunity and a role with significant autonomy and responsibility. The role will suit someone who is more backend focused but wanting to take the next step in their career to become “full stack”.
Initial responsibilities will include assisting our current agency dev team as we transition to a complete in-house dev team. As only the third hire within the development team, you will be an integral member of our ecosystem and will help us develop our company culture.
We operate a flexible work environment. Our offices are in central London and team meetings, brainstorming sessions and other collaborative projects will require attendance in person one or two times a month. All development time can be home based.
We want to work with people who are passionate, curious and honest, so if that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.
Ideally you should have most or all of the following:
5+ years working as a Ruby on Rails web developer
Software Development – Design patterns & Best practices
Refactoring Techniques
Testing (RSPEC)
Heroku

Experience developing public-facing websites that perform well on all devices using modern languages and frameworks

Based in the UK

Title: Junior Front End WordPress Developer
Job description:
Utilising a variety of markup languages to develop pixel-perfect, responsive web pages.
Ensuring web development is optimized for smartphones.
full-description:
SoBold is a high-performance, WordPress website design and development agency based in London. We have gone from strength to strength since our inception in 2014 and now is the time to super-charge this.
We are looking for an ambitious Junior Front End WordPress Developer to join our growing team. We work with companies of all sizes from small boutique brands, to publicly listed businesses and household names.
In this role, you will work closely with other Back End and Front End WordPress Developers and will report directly to the Lead Developer. You must be confident and willing to bring innovative ideas to the table.
Key Responsibilities
Utilising a variety of markup languages to develop pixel-perfect, responsive web pages.
Ensuring web development is optimized for smartphones.
Building reusable code for future use.
Optimizing web pages for maximum speed and scalability.
Create documentation outlining processes and/or offering advice on how to go about tackling certain issues for clients and other team members.
Snagging and testing websites to ensure they adhere to our high standards.
--
Key Requirements
Proficiency in HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
A minimum of at least 2 years of experience with PHP to render WordPress websites.
Experience with custom post types, Gutenberg and the Advanced Custom Fields plugin.
Basic knowledge of GIT based workflows.
A minimum of at least 2 years of experience with WordPress.
Experience with responsive and adaptive design.
Understanding of SEO principles.
Good problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills.
--
Benefits
Annual discretionary bonus
Private Healthcare
25 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)
A hybrid working environment, with up to two days working from home per week after your first three months.
--
Our hiring process
You can apply for this role on Indeed, LinkedIn or directly on our website, you'll hear back from us either way.
Here's a brief overview of what you can expect from the rest of our hiring process:
1) We review your application and portfolio.
2) A 30-minute phone call with our Lead Developer so we can find out more about you and you can find out more about the business and role.
3) A small WordPress related task.
4) A follow-up interview with our Lead Developer and Managing Director to discuss how you found the task.
5) A face-to-face meeting to give you a flavour of our team and offices and so we can give you an introduction to some of our workflows and processes.
6) Get an offer!
--

Title: Software Sales Engineer
Job description:
Business or technical education, ideally degree level in engineering, economics, maths or software development.

full-description:
Software Sales Engineer – Energy Market
EnAppSys Ltd is a software services provider to whole energy markets. With an unparalleled reputation and a key player in the transition to a zero carbon economy we provide cutting edge software and consultancy services to companies all over the world varying from small boutique trading houses to large household names. EnAppSys is considered a leader in its field and advises governments, regulators, energy traders, generators and consumer suppliers, asset builders, banks and private equity houses on the operation of wholesale energy markets across Europe.
We are seeking a Software Sales person to work closely with our teams in the UK and the Netherlands, providing technical expertise to our customers throughout the GB market whilst contributing to EnAppSys’ drive towards building a wider customer base throughout Europe. We aim to grow by winning new business while maximizing revenue with our current end users. This is a new role and therefore an exciting opportunity for a professional ideally from the IT or energy markets to develop sales strategies, maintain customer contact, provide technical and market insight and assist with the development of our existing product and customer base.
The role:
Deliver on monthly, quarterly and annual sales targets

Title: Senior Magento Developer
Job description:
Several years of experience in general coding and software design in in PHP 7.x in particular.
Senior Magento Developer – Full time work from Home*.
full-description:
Senior Magento Developer – Full time work from Home
About RedCloud
Open Commerce, RedCloud, and a $31TN race to market
Our mission is to grow global online commerce for the world’s small businesses by removing the barriers to online trading for hundreds of millions of independent retailers and their suppliers across the world’s supply chains. Despite the growth in e-commerce, less than 3% of B2B trading is made online, and yet, FMCG is Largest Product Category in the world - this is a $30tn business in emerging markets with over 1 million manufacturers, 20m distributors and wholesalers and finally over 500m independent retailers, who are the vital route to market serving over 7bn people every day.
When we ask independent retailers why they don’t trade online with FMCG brands, “we don’t know where to even start” is one of the top reasons we hear. That’s because selling, buying, and paying across B2B supply chains is long, complicated, and fragmented; Payments and purchasing are deeply manual, independent retailers have limited visibility on new products and sales opportunities, and FMCG’s (particularly up and coming brands) find it very difficult to reach new retailers and distributors and set up a rapid go to market. Due to antiquated payments networks, and the high cost of payment processing, over 19tn of trade payments are made offline, adding an enormous burden to online trading, with a 500m+ stores that function every day as powerful outlets for consumer brands, directly influence >80% of local consumer buying behaviour but they are often the least technically equipped with data, pricing, or the latest inventory.
The rapidly growing number of new brands, the rise of the middle-class consumer, and the growth in entrepreneurship has driven the need for a new kind of commerce dynamic, accessing key payment and sales points to enable FMCG’S, Distributors and sellers to trade smarter. So we built an Open Commerce Platform that enables the sale and distribution of FMCG products to be made much simpler. Products should be in front of sellers fast, in real-time, through an immersive commerce experience, with trade buyers and sellers able to see live commerce opportunities and pricing. We have built a digital ecosystem that is specifically designed to unlock the full value of the distribution network, providing real-time visibility for order and inventory management. Our innovative platform provides brands and distributors with deep data insights into buyer trends and behaviour and helps identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling products.
What you will be doing
· You will be involved in product design, scoping and estimation sessions alongside the Product and Project Management teams
· As a Senior Developer, you will take ownership of all Magento development within the company and help to grow our internal Magento development team including hiring new talent
· You will deliver and customise bespoke Magento modules and functionality including frontend, backend, and integrations
· Be able to estimate and then meet agreed delivery dates
· Participate in peer reviews of other team members’ code and provide mentoring to strengthen the team around you
· Liaise with our designers to build compelling user interfaces
· Provide of technical support and guidance to the wider ecommerce team relating to custom and core Magento functionality
We are looking for a focused and passionate individual to join us to develop RedCloud’s open marketplace solution on the Magento 2 platform as well as assist with scaling our in-house development team.
Your role will be to oversee our Magento architecture, build new features (both frontend and backend) and liaise with 3rd party teams. You should have demonstrable experience in the eCommerce space using Magento 2.3. You should be adaptable and agile in your approach, prioritising business goals and delivering high-quality solutions.
What you should have:
· Proven commercial experience as a Magento 2 Developer building and maintaining custom modules.
· Detailed product knowledge of Magento 2 Open Source including systems functionality and system architecture
· An understanding of the most popular third-party modules included in the standard Magento 2 installation
· Several years of experience in general coding and software design in in PHP 7.x in particular
· Familiar with the main database entities for Magento 2 on a MySQL platform
· Familiar with Magneto 2 front end development, html, CSS and templates customization
· Familiar with Magento 2 REST API endpoints and usage
· Experienced with CI and testing tools
· Proficient with GitHub code versioning, branching, merging etc.
· A solid understanding of both frontend and backend development best practices including secure development
· Strong understanding of web standards and best practices, especially pertaining to ecommerce
Other skills and experience which would be beneficial
· Ideally working towards or a holder of any Adobe certified Magento certification
· Has worked in an agile development environment
· Good communication skills
· Experience with caching systems like varnish and Redis
· Experience of scaling up a Magento platform to handle large customer volumes
· Able to write unit and integration tests
Benefits
Working with a pioneering provider of eCommerce solutions you will have the opportunity to join an international company who are growing massively, we encourage ambition and creativity.
Plus, you will get:
· First-class salary
· Private Healthcare and Life Assurance
· Pension Plan
· Company equipment

SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER
BASED PENRITH / NW ENGLAND SALARY C£60,000 PLUS EMI OPTIONS / EQUITY
Based in the beautiful Lake District town of Penrith, ESS’ client is a soon to be global leader in the design, build, assembly and deployment of ground breaking LED technologies in the water treatment and industrial process control arena. They are steadily building a global client portfolio in drinking water treatment, waste water treatment and control of surface micro-organism e.g. Algae industrial automation. The Penrith operations continues to go from strength to strength and they would like to recruit a Senior Software Engineer with a solid C++ background.
Reporting into the Head of Engineering, the Senior Software Engineer will join a multi-disciplinary team including hardware / electronics design engineers, mechanical engineers, a firmware specialist and process control engineers. You will take full control of the front end software development road map, supporting existing products and technologies, before moving onto NPD software development and design as part of new LED lighting / product architecture and development. This will include:
· Industrial control systems.
· HMI Display systems.
· Test system applications.
· Production test systems.
· Preparation of requirements, specifications, design and test schedules.
· Support to documentation team.
· Factory acceptance testing of software components within product deliveries.
· Technology research.
The successful candidate is educated to degree calibre in a technical, engineering or computer science discipline. We would be especially keen to hear from candidates who have worked on front end software development for engineered products and/or industrial automation equipment across any industry. A solid background in C++ and some Gui / Python is required. Other key technical experience should include: Basic TCP/IP networking, RS485, ModBus. MQTT. NodeRED. Control Systems SW development and system integration.
The candidate will need to be onsite regularly to liaise with the team and in some cases travel to client sites as part of the implementation process. We would ask that suitable candidate are able to live and/or commute easily to Penrith – relocation support is an option if required.
A highly competitive salary (up to £60,000 DOE) will be offered to the right person. An employee benefits package is available including support for professional qualification, health and disability insurance and EMI share options program. This is a permanent position in a fast moving company, with excellent opportunities. Motivated and creative self starters will find that there is huge scope to develop their skills and experience in an agile fast growth start up.
To apply please send your CV to our recruitment partner Bruce Hydes at ESS Recruit.

Title: Backend Developer for SaaS Project
Job description: A software engineer at heart and you’re comfortable writing software to solve problems, with an interest in distributed systems and writing resilient, scalable…
full-description:
Back End Developer for SaaS Project
Our challenge….
2022 is going to be a year of great change for our product. Over many years it has become fundamental to our operations and those of our 130+ e-commerce clients as an internal system. We are now taking the brave steps and branching out into the SaaS world and need to build a team of exceptional, innovative developers to take us there.
The software is a cloud-based solution for e-commerce order fulfilment. What does that mean, I hear you ask? Well, fulfilment is where we hold stock in our worldwide warehouses, orders come into the system and they are picked and packed, shipping is calculated and then despatched to the customer. But it doesn’t stop there, for us to be able to receive orders we integrate with online marketplaces (like Amazon, Ebay, Wayfair, etc) and that’s still only part of the story….. we also maintain the listings of products, stock levels, price changes and adding new products, so our dearly beloved software does a lot!
The main functions are to manage our Warehouse, Fulfilment and Logistics platform from start to finish in a secure environment with the GCP as our bedrock. From inventory management to controlling orders across multiple e-commerce sales channels, the system is the backbone of our company and ensures our global warehouse locations operate at peak performance 24/7.
What’s the team like?
I’d say we are a pretty diverse bunch, who get along together very nicely. We come up with some brilliant ideas on how to solve the businesses issues, almost on a world domination scale at times! When we are not changing the world, we work with some of the latest technologies to design, build and tweak the software so it can become the best in class.
We are passionate about finding solutions to make the process of moving goods around the world as seamless as possible, so our customers and their customers get a great experience. All this commitment requires a little downtime now and again to catch our breath, so our weekly #coffeebreak is a great way to connect both our office and remote workers for ½ hour of fun (sometimes it gets a little competitive) share ideas and find out what’s happening in the team.
The technical bit of your role….
Joining our team as a backend developer will give you the opportunity to work with a wide range of tools and technologies. As a growing technology focused company, we are always looking to evaluate and use the best tools for the job, so we welcome people who are enthusiastic about our current tech stack and relish the idea of learning new technologies & techniques within their role.
Our primary backend services are written in PHP (7 & 8) using the Laravel framework, to provide REST APIs for our frontend team to consume within our Angular frontend. You will have the opportunity to tackle interesting and complex problems, in a bid to produce fast and reliable software that processes hundreds of thousands of orders a month.
Specific parts of our backend have been broken out into microservices written in Golang, this has enabled us to provide narrow focused and performant task processing as part of our wider APIs.
The backend team is also responsible for maintaining our Public API written in NodeJS and Typescript and used by lots of companies to help build out the app store ecosystem that grows the platform in new directions.
Within your role you will deploy code into a modern cloud-based environment with a full featured CI/CD system. We make heavy use of Docker and deploy all our services into Google Cloud using Kubernetes and Helm charts. Our APIs are backed by a fully managed MySQL database and make use of many emerging cloud native technologies such as data warehousing tools, caching services and comprehensive cloud monitoring systems.
The Stack…
The technologies and tools we rely on are:
· PHP (Laravel) – Most of our core system.
· JS (Angular) – Frontend, IOS & Android apps
· GCP – for most of our infrastructure
· GO & NodeJS – Microservices
· Kubernetes – to schedule and run our services
· Docker – for local development
· MySQL – Primary DB
· Elasticsearch – Search & Paging
Think this may be you?
A software engineer at heart and you’re comfortable writing software to solve problems, with an interest in distributed systems and writing resilient, scalable software.
You are familiar with some of our Platform technologies or specialise in just one part and keen to learn more about new technologies and work within a team dedicated to keeping the wheels turning.
If you have any logistics, warehousing or SaaS experience, that’s a big plus for us.
About us…
At I-Fulfilment we currently have around 150 employees at our location in Christchurch, Dorset. As we speak our new building at Bournemouth Airport is reaching its final stages of completion for us to move to in April 2022. This exciting new office & warehouse has been purpose built to provide a unique working environment. It will have a Barista Station, Gym, Yoga room, Wellbeing room, Breakout areas and an outside viewing platform over the airport with a BBQ area. Next year is a very exciting time for us with not only the software, but with our expansion plans becoming reality. It’s a great time to be involved in shaping our future. We look forward to meeting you.
To apply please submit your CV and a few words on why we need you!

full-description:
Not all connections are created equal. Neither are teams.
The Westbase Group is an independent provider of telecommunications equipment and services to the industry. We support our partners across Europe to deliver solutions that connect businesses and their teams.
Our companies – Westbase.io, MS Distribution, Control and Wireless Coverage – all have their unique teams, identities and purposes. Together as a Group though we share a common passion for connected working, the last mile connectivity solutions we deliver, and how they enable businesses to move forwards.
This means that creating a team and environment where every individual can thrive is key to how we work. Both professionally and personally we’re committed to helping every person progress in their chosen career path.
We know that not all teams are created equal, so we work hard to create an environment which is stimulating and inclusive. Our teams are encouraged to take initiative and work together and every employee has the opportunity to make an impact.
Your role.
As a Business Systems Developer your focus will be supporting the development and maintenance of our business tools and eco-system across our group of companies. Working with our Business Systems Owner, you will help map, design and optimise our Systems to meet the groups evolving business needs and provide the tools to meet our strategic goals. A natural problem solver, who focuses on simple solutions that have big impacts, you will be exceptional at understanding process and mapping solutions to support them. An autonomous individual who communicates clearly, you will be accountable for:
Contributing to the development and implementing our business systems strategy
Reviewing and optimising our existing business processes
Creating documentation to support the operational business and the development of new features
Driving maximum value from our business systems investment
Peering with Business Systems Owner to ensure the security of our business systems
Securely providing Customer and 3rd party access to relevant systems information
Focusing on business automation, making our teams as efficient as possible
Integrating systems through the Azure Cloud platform
What you need to have.
To do this job well you need to have:
A passion for delivering solutions to business owners in a fast-paced environment
Excellent problem-solving abilities
Experience delivering systems integration and an excellent understanding of software technologies
An understanding of finance, logistics and other business processes
Office365 skills, particularly advanced Excel, and Power BI (or equivalent)
Good communication skills and stakeholder management skills
Experience of working in high pressure, collaborative environments
Ability to learn on the job as new challenges arise
A proactive attitude with the ability to adapt, and a willingness to take on tasks normally outside your remit – a “roll up your sleeves” approach is desired
2+ years development experience
Experience with C#
The following experience and qualifications are also desirable, but not essential:
Degree-level or equivalent education in Computer Science, IT, or Finance
An understanding of relational databases and schemas
Technical and working knowledge of common integration and scripting methods (SQL, JavaScript, APIs, etc.)
Hands on NetSuite experience including customising workflows and scripting
Understanding of Agile processes, and specifically SAFe which is practiced in the business
We are looking to hire energetic, committed people interested in the tech that we have to offer – and who understand that we perform best when we work together across our company. If this sounds like you, then get in touch.

full-description:
This is a Senior Project Engineer role within the Delivery function covering Cloud & Server
They key deliverables of this role include:
Project Delivery
Creation of cloud / server solutions (physical and virtual / cloud) designs based upon client requirements. Creation of implementation and test plans for delivery. Implementation of network solutions with post implementation support. Handover of project delivery to Service Desk and, where required, training of Service Desk Analysts.
Service Desk
Act as 3rd Line escalation point for Service Desk incident tickets. Investigation and resolution of allocated Incident Tickets and Event Notifications with agreed client Incident Categorisations with associated Service Level Agreements.
Pre-Sales
Support the Pre-Sales team, as required, with proposed solution designs within Commercial Proposals for server / hosting solutions that meet client enquiry requirements.
ContracCloud
ContracCloud is Contrac’s private hosting platform. The role requires supporting the strategic development, implementation, testing, monitoring and management of the platform. This includes, but is not limited to, operational stability, server patching, backup, event management and availability management.
The role is predominantly office based within standard working hours, with travel to other Contrac offices and Customer sites will be required. Out of hours working may also be required during out of hours deliveries and escalated 3rd Line tickets.

Ideally having worked with multiple solutions at once
Dealt with users of all levels.

Adaptable attitude to meet ever changing environment and challenges
